174080.name: Ur-Shogga, the All-Consuming Thought
174080.description:
From publisher blurb:

“You are what you eat. Soon, I'll be you.”

Walid ibn Jaffa al-Souk is an eccentric merchant, eager to boast about the efficacy of his alchemical wares and wish a customer a fine sunset. He seems nice – too bad he died years ago. Walid and so many others are little more that suits of clothes these days for a strange and insidious puppetmaster. The scuttling intellect devourer Ur-Shogga is a hidden master of the Tarnished Souk, hiding behind the smiles of its hollow-headed host bodies as it plots, plans, and gathers power.

This product provides Game Masters with details on a bewitching brain found amongst the Faces of the Tarnished Souk, ready for immediate use in any campaign - but especially for use within the Coliseum Morpheuon. Each entry features ingenious stat-blocks from multiple OGL sources, history, motivation, secrets, and insight into the NPC’s most carefully guarded dreams, along with complete game statistics for low, middle, and high levels of play.

Within you will find:

Ur-Shogga, the mind behind it all

CR 21 Advanced cunning locomotion handicapped intellect devourer sorcerer (crossblooded, wildblooded) 16
CR 14 Cunning locomotion handicapped intellect devourer sorcerer (crossblooded, wildblooded) 10
CR 7 Locomotion handicapped intellect devourer sorcerer (crossblooded, wildblooded) 1
Eleven (11!) fully stat-blocked and templated NPC host bodies for this brainy aberration to wear

174082.name: Yog'vhus'chuul, Harbinger of the Deeping Void
174082.description:
From publisher blurb:

“You need not prepare for our arrival. We are here.”
Dream is a quirky place, but there are far realms of alien madness which make even our nightmares shudder. At the forefront of a tide of madness is a lowly worm, dancing with a host of twisted beasts in celebration of the mad new world to come. From the depths of the sea of our unconscious comes Yog'vhus'chuul, the first of many through the gate.

This product provides Game Masters with details on a wriggling worm found amongst the Faces of the Tarnished Souk, ready for immediate use in any campaign - but especially for use within the Coliseum Morpheuon. Each entry features ingenious stat-blocks from multiple OGL sources, history, motivation, secrets, and insight into the NPC’s most carefully guarded dreams, along with complete game statistics for low, middle, and high levels of play.

Within you will find:

Yog'vhus'chuul – a druid of the deep who's a crawling creep

CR 21 Male aquatic divine worm that walks young sync druid (blight, mystic) 15
CR 15 Male aquatic divine worm that walks young sync druid (blight, mystic) 9
CR 10 Male aquatic worm that walks young sync druid (blight, mystic) 4
A menagerie of augmented aberrant creatures created to serve the elder gods
Featuring a host of templates, brand new magic items, feats and traits!
The harbinger of a creeping doom so terrible it will change all

174083.name: ION
174083.description: A cross between UNO and Dominos. ION is a deck of domino cards with special actions on some that are taken during play. The first player to get rid of all the cards in their hand wins.

174084.name: Four More Years!
174084.description:
A presidential election game that tracks elections from 1960 to 2012. Republicans fight Democrats for control of the White House and advancing their agendas.

Players run the gauntlet of primaries using chits and dice to resolve debates, scandals and all the pitfalls that come in American politics to determine who will represent their party in a national election. Your goal is to somehow get the best nominee through the process and win the general election.

174085.name: Scrabble 2003 Edition
174085.description:
Game cover


Up-to-date with official Scrabble glossary
Improved AI intelligence
Different levels in opponents, from beginner to expert
Different play modes, such as "Longest Word" and "Duplicate"
Multiplayer: 4 players on LAN, 3 players via Internet

174086.name: Micro Play-Break: Kingdoms
174086.description:
The dying King is a shrewd man with more gold than compassion. Unable to choose between his two offspring whom to name as his successor, the King devised a challenge, bequeathing to them small Kingdoms in the far corners of his vast territory.

Who will earn the right to the throne? Only the most clever will succeed either by building an impenetrable fortress or eliminating the competition.

Objective: The winner is the first to either have a knight outside the forest that cannot be captured or be the only player with a knight on the board outside the forest.

Play: On their turn, each player will place, move, or flip pieces on the game board. Player options come from the pieces not-currently-on-the-board, meaning greater options are available to those who have fewer pieces in play.

174087.name: How to Train Your Dragon 2: Sheep Launcher Game
174087.description: How To Train Your Dragon 2: Sheep Launcher Game is a game for 2-4 players. Players place plastic, disc-shaped sheep tokens onto little plastic catapults, which they use to launch the tokens into nets located on a stand erected on the center of the board. Each player moves their dragon marker forward by the number of points scored each shooting round. Double points are scored with the black sheep token, or by shooting a token into your own net (matched to your catapult color). The first person to get their dragon marker around the board first wins the game.

174088.name: Sid Meier's Starships
174088.description:
Take command of a fleet of powerful starships in this adventure-driven strategy game from legendary designer Sid Meier.
Build and command a fleet of starships and travel between planets as you explore, build, negotiate, and fight to preserve your vision for humanity.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamecompilation: Dixit: "The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: The Pact" Promo Cards
174089.description: For the anniversary of Dixit (6 years!) Libellud will release, in partnership with the International Game Fair of Cannes, the "anniversary pack", sold only on the Libellud booth during the fair. It will feature 16 promotional cards: 11 cards already published but unobtainable, and 5 new cards created for the occasion by the Dixit illustrators. All profits will be donated to the association "Un hopital pour les enfants".
174089.name: Dixit: Anniversary Pack

174090.description: Dixit: Memories is a set of 84 new cards that add value to existing Dixit releases.
174090.name: Dixit: Memories

boardgamecompilation: Neuroshima Hex! Żetony promocyjne – zestaw I
174091.description:
A 1-tile mini-expansion for Neuroshima Hex! The tile is treated by each player as their own tile - it does not block the line of fire, it can be moved by a Move tile, can be connected to Modules etc. By sacrificing one HP of their own HQ, a player can trigger the Night Hunter's special attack against a neighboring enemy tile.

NIGHT HUNTER

Perfect hunter. It appers, inflicts death and disappears into the darkness. It avoids light. Nobody knows who it really is. Nobody knows how it looks like. Nobody can face him.




TILE TYPE:

Common tile - it belongs to every army at the same time and is treated by every player as their own: it doesn't block the line of fire, it can be moved by an own Move tile, own Modules can be connected to it, it cannot be damaged (except with Bomb, which is also damaging own units), it cannot be pushed away, netted, taken over etc.
If it gets destroyed, Night Hunter is removed from the game.





Placed on the board at the beginning of the game - at the beginning of the game, before placing HQs, this tile is placed on any hex on the board except edge hexes and the center of the map.


NIGHT HUNTER DESCRIPTION:

Devour - A player can trigger a Night Hunter's special attack at the cost of 1 Toughness point of HQ to destroy a tile adjecent to Night Hunter indicated by the the Devour icon (it can also be an own tile of the player who triggered Night Hunter's attack).
Devour does no harm to HQs.
Night Hunter does not attack during normal Battle.





Mobility - A player, during his turn, may move Night Hunter by 2 fields and turn him freely. However player can move Night Hunter by one field and turn him freely, then activate Devour (at the cost of 1 wound to his HQ) and then move Night Hunter by the second field and turn him freely.
174091.name: Neuroshima Hex! Nocny Łowca

boardgamehonor: 2016 Årets Spel Best Family Game Nominee
174093.name: Maze Racers
boardgamepodcastepisode: 07 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Story Time!
08 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Maze Racers!
10 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Gamification – and Contest!
35 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Budget-Friendly Games
174093.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Maze Racers, you use the enclosed magnetic walls and a good dose of creativity to build the most wicked maze possible that will leave your opponent scrambling to find his way out. The game is also a race against time as your opponent is building his own devilish contraption. When the time is up, both sides switch their maze boards and steer a ball through the opponent's maze as quickly as they can. Be the fastest in two out of three rounds to claim victory!

174094.name: 40 Years of Gen Con
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
174094.description:
from the back of the book

In 40 Years of Gen Con, gaming guru Robin D. Laws chronicles the story of every gamer's lifetime. It's a history that reaches out to four decades of gamers to form a vast collage of the Gen Con experience from every point of view - from the gamers playing in the halls, to the staffers behind the scenes, to the exhibitors on the sales floor.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
174095.description:
A long time ago, the Emperor of China offered to the Emperor of Japan a giant panda, a symbol of peace. Your delicate mission: Take care of the animal by planning a bamboo field. Now as a reward for your great work, you are being offered a second panda...a female!

Takenoko: Chibis includes a miniature of the female panda, nine different tiles for the baby pandas, six plot tiles, 18 cards, and 17 bamboo pieces.
174095.name: Takenoko: Chibis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Boardcast News 4.16.15 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 13 - Couples Night
Episode 37: The Bauzaspansion Episode (Ft. Takenoko Chibis, Tokaido Crossroads, Above&Below)
Episode 6 - Our GenCon 2015 Preview and Twilight Struggle Review
Favorite Games of 2015
MN 0088 Takenoko & Takenoko: Chibis
The Good, The Board, and the Ugly Behaviors: Episode 20 “Dealing with Bad Players”
The Long View - Quick Looks #9
Vox Republica 094: The CR At Gen Con 2015 - Part 1
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 34!!!

174096.description: New discovery tiles for the base game : 9 simple discovery tiles showing references to TricTracTV, Indiana Jones, Cthulhu, Terminator, a double discovery tile showing a Moai and more...
174096.name: Archaeologia: The Goodies

174097.name: ¡Ahora Caigo!
174097.description: Boardgame of the popular Spanish TV show '¡Ahora caigo!', presented by Arturo Valls. It'a a trivia game.

174098.name: Supporting Cast: Fellow Travellers: 64 NPCs you might meet on the road
174098.description:
publisher blurb

This PDF gives you 64 different NPC sketches of travellers on the road for your d20, OGL or Pathfinder games

174099.name: Supporting Cast: Fellow Travellers 2: 100 NPCs you might meet on the road
174099.description:
publisher blurb

This PDF gives you 100 different NPC sketches of travellers on the road for your d20, OGL or Pathfinder games

boardgameimplementation: Larger Than Life: The Game of Pulp Adventures
174101.description:
What is Larger Than Life - Director's Cut?
It’s a game about the Pulps. That means Lost Worlds, intrepid Archaeologists, Cliffhangers, and more. The setting may be exotic, the villains particularly villainous, but in truth, it’s all about the Story. Whether it’s finding treasure, saving someone, or thwarting the villain, it all boils down to the Story.

Larger Than Life – Directors Cut can be likened to an action movie where your Hero moves from Scene to Scene trying to succeed in his adventure. What needs to be done? How do you do it? Who’s in peril? Who’s behind all this? All these things and more are generated for you by the easy to use game mechanics. Inside Larger Than Life – Director’s Cut you’ll find:


A variety of characters for you to play with and against. Stars, Co-Stars, Love Interests, Femme Fatales, and of course, the villains – we call them the Big Bads.
Over 35 Attributes that you can mix and match to make your characters unique.
A system that allows your characters to increase in skills and abilities when they succeed, but force them into “retirement” when they fail.
An easy to use mechanic that will generate and solve Clues, during each Story, based on your characters abilities. Solve the Clues and you make it to the Final Scene.
Nine different villains to fight, from Mob Bosses to Cavemen, and everything in between.
Four different Locales to adventure in. From the back alleys of a large Metropolis, to the villages in a Lost World, your Hero can travel from place to place, all generated by the game mechanics.
Over fifty Professions to create Victims, Suspects, and People of Interest and enrich your Story.
Mechanics that generate hundreds of possible adventures, with no two ever being alike.
Playable solo, cooperatively, or head to head.
174101.name: Larger Than Life: Director's Cut
boardgameexpansion: Larger Than Life: Director's Cut – Action!

174102.description:
It's springtime in the garden. The sun is shining, the birds are singing and flowers are blooming. All appears well, apart from those pesky aphids. However, all is not quite as it seems. Other dangers lurk just around the corner - or should that be underground? The warmer weather is bringing ants, from their colony and into your garden, bearing gifts... aphid eggs; eggs that they have been keeping safe during the cold spells of winter. Now the time is right for the eggs to be brought to the perfect location, ready for hatching. Unfortunately, that perfect place just happens to be your beautiful flower!

As usual, the first player who clears his Garden of parasites is the winner, but this time the parasites are harder to eradicate... and there’s always a surprise or two in store!
174102.name: Ladybug Lunch: Ant Antics

174103.name: Gravity Ghost
174103.description:
User Summary

Gravity Ghost is a game about Iona, who lost her best friend, a fox called Voy. While searching for Voy you explore a galaxy and rescue spirit animals. Slowly during gameplay you uncover why you are in space and what happend. To find Voy and find out what happend you need to clear the levels and meet the 7 magical guardians. To do this, you need to jump, run and orbit through the galaxy, while discovering new abilities and terraforming possibilities.

174104.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 50 - Feb 24, 2015)
174104.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #50: Artifact Quality

Fantasy games thrive on magical weapons and items, giving players something to shoot for — and to shoot with. These are rewards for overcoming obstacles and defeating monsters, both reflecting and boosting the characters’ growing power and expertise. To provide your science fiction game with similar options, this issue describes a system for including equipment of exceptional quality. While your Elf might draw a +5 vorpal sword from a dark knight’s sarcophagus, your replicant gets to instead haul a master quality gauss pistol from a brain lasher’s lair. This system also includes the shoddy end of the quality spectrum, for those times when patchwork or jury-rigging is the best your tech mutant can manage.

174105.name: Cthulhu Britannica: London
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
174105.description:
From the publisher:

London in the 1920s is the greatest city in the world, a vibrant melting pot of history and culture at the heart of the British Empire. But underneath the powerhouse of the City lie millennia of history, from the well-documented paths of Roman Londinium to darker antediluvian secrets veiled from modern eyes. London sits atop its history: an ancient swampland that was itself once an even-more-ancient sea-bed. Who knows what secrets lie buried?

The Cthulhu Britannica: London boxed set comprises:
- The Investigator's Guide to London
- The Keeper's Guide to London
- Adventures in Mythos London
- Six sheets of beautifully designed handouts
- Four poster maps, including a beautifully illustrated Macdonald Gill map of Central London

174106.name: Trouble in Valderheim
174106.description:
From publisher blurb:

A short generic fantasy adventure for Savage Worlds!

The small outpost of Valderheim needs assistance in dealing with a bandit problem.

Includes map images for online games with both a grid and without a grid!

174107.name: Ponyfinder for Fifth Edition
174107.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you joined the crowd and checked out the fifth edition of the longest running fantasy roleplaying game in the world? But you want ponies? We have you covered, dear stallion and/or mare, with the Ponyfinder conversion guide!

These easy to follow rules will let you create an Everglow race in your 5th edition game with no problem at all! Unicorns, pegasi, griffons and more are included in these 10 pages of statistical wonder. The rules assume you already own the Ponyfinder Campaign Setting for background information, places, and history, though it is possible to play with just the 5th edition books and this handy racial book.

174108.name: Children of Bones
174108.description:
From publisher blurb:

The near forgotten tribe of bones was crushed beneath the heel of the forming empire. The ponies that made it up were killed or scattered, but they were never entirely destroyed. Remnants of this once powerful tribe still lurk through the pony lands, and even beyond it, praying to the Soft Whisper and doing their small parts to tend to the deceased of ponykind.

Learn more about these shamans, with expanded historic information, stats to play your own, new spells and feats, as well as a tribe specific class archetype in this player-friendly expansion for Ponyfinder.

174109.name: Psi-punk: Corps and Criminals
174109.description:
From publisher blurb:


Crime Pays for Some

What’s the difference between a megacorporation and a mafia? One of them isn’t being watched by the government.

They say absolute power corrupts absolutely, but some would argue that corruption comes first. Getting to the top requires cunning, guile, and influence. Staying there requires wealth, prestige, and firepower. Great leaders possess all of these qualities, whether they run the corporations which control our lives or the criminal empires which keep the corps in check.

Corps and Criminals introduces you to several different types of organizations to use in your next game of Psi-punk. From street gangs who are working their way up to the brightest beacons of capitalism, you’ll find plenty of organizations to align with—or against.

This book includes:

8 Megacorps, each with a unique corporate culture, advice for GMs on how they fit into your game and tips for players on how to include them in your background.
12 Cartels of 3 varieties: ghost cartels, arms cartels, and trafficking cartels. GM advice on how each of these organizations fit into your world and how to interact with them.
14 gangs with their own motives and methods, with sample NPCs for their leaders and goons.
7 Mafias from around the world, including sample NPCs for their bosses and henchmen.
Plenty of inspiration for Game Masters and players.

174110.description:
Part of a series of promotional command cards released during Dungeon Command organized play events featuring alternate art by Steve Ellis. Each card is otherwise identical to a command card featured in the core Dungeon Command Sets.

Into the Fray non-promo stock card is also contained in Dungeon Command: Heart of Cormyr.
174110.name: Dungeon Command: Into the Fray Promo

174111.description:
Part of a series of promotional command cards released during Dungeon Command organized play events featuring alternate art by Steve Ellis. Each card is otherwise identical to a command card featured in the core Dungeon Command Sets.

Secret Passage non-promo stock card is also contained in Dungeon Command: Sting of Lolth.
174111.name: Dungeon Command: Secret Passage Promo

174112.description:
Part of a series of promotional command cards released during Dungeon Command organized play events featuring alternate art by Steve Ellis. Each card is otherwise identical to a command card featured in the core Dungeon Command Sets.

Mirror Image non-promo stock card is also contained in Dungeon Command: Tyranny of Goblins.
174112.name: Dungeon Command: Mirror Image Promo

174113.description:
Part of a series of promotional command cards released during Dungeon Command organized play events featuring alternate art by Steve Ellis. Each card is otherwise identical to a command card featured in the core Dungeon Command Sets.

Magic Short Sword non-promo stock card is also contained in Dungeon Command: Curse of Undeath.
174113.name: Dungeon Command: Magic Short Sword Promo

174114.name: Tempest
174114.description:
From publisher blurb:

TEMPEST!

Last of our Teen Villain Month. Spoiled since birth and bitter from the lack of attention he received, Tempest is out to cause trouble in your next adventure! Armed with the power of the storm, he'll bring the thunder and lightning against your heroes!

174115.name: Hall of Statues
174115.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Hall of Statues.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT).

“The old gods have been weakened and need sacrifices to survive performed by the few faithful left. Capture them for sacrifices to the true elder gods!”

Descending into a maze of columns and statues you are surprised to find the corridors lit as torches fill the sconces. Clearly someone or something is continuing to take care of this place. As you near the back of the maze, you spot a huge pit of skeletons. Is this a place of worship or a catacomb? Or both.

Hall of Statues is a maze of columns and statues with a dark secret.

Hall of Statues is intended for use in fantasy or historical games (medieval or earlier).

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Blood to Power the Gods: The Hall of Statues has many unique statues, mostly of animals rather than men. The entire area has sconces with lit torches in them showing the area has someone or something taking care of the upkeep of this location. As the group approaches the back of the halls, they find themselves surrounded by men in golden robes with embroidered images similar to the statues they have seen in the halls. They may also see skeletons lying around, stripped of all flesh in positions that suggest they were murdered. The men in golden robes attempt to capture the group and then sacrifice them to their gods in a bizarre ritual with ivory sacrificial daggers with carved hilts with the statue’s images again. After stabbing them with their knives, they then summon their “gods” to strip the flesh of the sacrifices.

174116.name: Wild West Exodus: Outlaw VS Lawmen
boardgameexpansion: Wild West Exodus: Female Dark Council miniature
Wild West Exodus: H-BOT 44 Mercenary miniature
174116.description:
Wild West Exodus is a miniatures game played by 2 to 4 players each fielding a posse of 3 to 40 models using exciting game play right from the first shot. Each player takes control of one of the five factions and every model has the potential to be a hero or a villain. Even with a larger number of miniatures on the table the WWX rules have been designed to keep the play fast and dynamic.

One of the most exciting parts of the Wild West Exodus game mechanic is the reusable influence pool. The influence pool will give players the option to gamble away a set amount of tokens in return for a reroll of the dice. Be careful what you gamble on because once the tokens are committed they are lost for that turn. The D10 system gives the game life and options that round out easily and allow for quick decision making.

174119.description:
Description from the publisher:

Are you such an expert pitchman that you can sell ice (that attracts beautiful butterflies all summer long) to Eskimos? Then the But Wait, There's More!: That's The Best Part! expansion for you! Every good pitchman lets his audience ask questions, and that's precisely what this expansion adds!

After each pitch, the next player plays their "That's the Best Part!" card, which contains a curious question such as "What happens if Grandma can't lift it?" or "What happens if it induces vomiting?". The pitching player responds with a confident "That's the Best Part!" and has to continue their pitch, quickly improvising an answer!

This add-on expansion contains forty new cards and brings a wonderfully entertaining new aspect to But Wait, There's More!
174119.name: But Wait, There's More!: That's The Best Part!

174120.name: But Wait, There's More!: Sixth Player Expansion
174120.description:
From the Toy Vault website:

What's better than five players playing But Wait, There's More? Six players playing But Wait, There's More! This expansion comes with enough vote cards to play with sixth players. But Wait, There's More! It also comes with a sixth company card! If you play the team variant in the rules, you can play with up to twelve players!

174121.name: But Wait, There's More!: Video Game Mini-Expansion
boardgamecompilation: But Wait, There's More!: Geek Expansion
174121.description:
From the Toy Vault website:

You love But Wait, There's More, but you love video games too! What can you do? Well never fear, we've combined your two loves into one magical expansion! That's right, you can now add our Video Game mini-expansion to your But Wait, There's More game! The Video Game mini-expansion comes with ten brand new cards all related to video games! So get ready to pitch your new game controller, that explodes on contact!

174122.name: But Wait, There's More!: Fantasy RPG Mini-Expansion
boardgamecompilation: But Wait, There's More!: Geek Expansion
174122.description:
From the Toy Vault website:

Time to level up your But Wait, There's More experience with our Fantasy RPG Mini Expansion! Add ten Fantasy RPG themed cards to your But Wait, There's More game! Everybody needs a 10' Pole, that transforms your dreams into reality!

174123.name: But Wait, There's More!: Superhero Mini-Expansion
boardgamecompilation: But Wait, There's More!: Geek Expansion
174123.description:
From the Toy Vault website:

Add ten super hero themed cards to your But Wait, There's More game! The Superhero Mini-Expansion has four new Products, and Six new Features! Everybody needs a shield, that shrinks to the size of an ant!

174124.description:
Get a lil' hillbilly on the lily! Draw tiles to make Froggy bands!

Howdy, Y'all. M'buddy SeaBass calls me “Song-Froggy”, and so can you's all, if'n ya like. I'm wit ya today to do some splainin' on dis here game ya got yer eyeballs on. Now, you're gonna need some scratch paper and a crayon to keep score, just so's ya know. The whole durn point of the game is to get you the most points, and the simplest of folks ought to be able earn at least some, jes' needs a little learnin' is all. What ya gotta do is get you some frogs, what might have the best sound together. Once you done that, you set them up as a band, and now nobody can be a copy-cat and go makin' a band wit dat same sound. It ain't hard, and I'm gunna be here every step to walk ya through it.

Now, ya got two choices every time it's your turn; y'all can pick up a frog and maybe get you some points, or ya can set you up a band and get ye couple more points. The rulebook's the place to get filled in on the par-tic-u-lars, but we ain't in the rulebook right now, is we? (Y'all can go ahead and download dem right now.)

So some of these froggies is 'specially talented, and don't need no backup in they band. You just give'm a washboard or a gutbucket, and they'll be bustin' out a tune in no time. Most frogs, though, they got specific idears on who it is they wanna play with. They'll tell ya, easy enough, just by checkin' out the background on the picture. W'chever frog you choose to lead your band, he's the one you need to mind on that. Check out dem der Action Shots for a peek at what ya got comin' to ya here.

Game's simple enough, folks, but ya can get still get to strategizin' if'n you put yer mind to it. Uncle Cletus might ought like it on account of it being so simple, and ya know you mama gonna like it, cuz all dem cute lil' froggies. I 'spect you'll be pickin' dis'n up fore too long.
174124.name: Song-Froggy

174125.name: Omen: A Reign of War – Omega Edition extras
boardgamecompilation: Omen: A Reign of War – Relics of Olympus
174125.description:
A combination of all the expansions included in the new Omega edition. These include Zeus' Challenge, Relics of Olympus and Tyche's Whims.

This set of expansions is offered to those who previously bought Omen, so they can get up to date with the newest edition.

174126.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Sirena 1793 was a frigate of the Spanish Armada that had previously served in the French Navy under the name Elene. Captured in May 1793 by frigates Santa Casilda and Perla, it returned to active service with the fleet based in Havana, doing mostly escorting service. In 1807, it was wrecked on the coast of Campeche (Mexico). This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Frigate "Ifigenia 1795". Each Sails of Glory Ship Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other Sails of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the ship: a special base with gaming stats, a ship log and a specific deck of maneuver cards. The ship base, ship card and ship log are printed on two sides - The game data of a second ship is printed on the back.
174126.name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Sirena 1793 / Ifigenia 1795

174127.name: Aqueducts
174127.description: Aqueducts is a tile laying game where you are trying to get the water from the center lake to all 4 buildings of your town. Making a viable town is no easy feat, luckily you have hex shaped aqueduct pieces to help you accomplish your goals. You will have to puzzle out your best path while contending with other players who can direct your aqueducts elsewhere. If you can overcome your opponents sabotage efforts and are the first to get water to all your town buildings, your town will survive and you will be victorious.

174128.name: Zambezi: The Expedition Game
174128.description:
In Zambezi: The Expedition Game, players race tugboats from Victoria Falls to Lake Kariba, avoiding crocodiles and rocks along the way while picking up commodities from staging posts and making documentaries about the animals of the Zambezi delta.

Zambezi: The Expedition Game includes rules for a shorter game that focus solely on the racing without the other elements of gameplay.

174129.name: Menagerie
174129.description:
Collect the most impressive animals!

Menagerie is a quick and fun card game for 2-4 players. Build the most impressive collection of animals while trying to not let your opponents take advantage of your moves.

In Menagerie you collect cards to build animals and collect animals to build collections. But when you pick cards that you can't use, you may have to give them to another player. Menagerie is quick to learn, quick to play and more fun than a barrel of monkeys!

174130.name: Table Golf
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 59 Having Great Snowball Battles During Table Golf
174130.description:
In Table Golf you transform your dining room table into a 9 hole golf course. where you flick cards down the table to try to get them into the hole.

At the beginning of each hole the players build the hole that they are playing on by flicking the hazards onto the course. there are Three hazards in this game the Water Hazard, the Sand Trap and the Rough. Each hazard has it's own way of testing your dexterity with the Golf Ball card.

Each Hole you select a weather card and that card effects how you play that hole. It can be use your non-dominate hand or flick the Golf Ball from a foot above the table.

At the end of the game the player who makes the ball in the hole consistently is considered the winner.

174131.name: Dragon Quest Heroes: The World Tree's Woe and the Blight Below
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Gamescom Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
174131.description:
A NEW ENTRY IN THE LEGENDARY DRAGON QUEST SERIES DRAWS NEAR!

One of the most beloved fantasy RPG franchises, DRAGON QUEST has captured the hearts of players around the globe with over 64 million units sold. Filled with characters and monsters as memorable as they are charming, majestic musical scores, and adorable mascot slimes, every iteration of the DRAGON QUEST series is an incredible journey from start to finish.

DRAGON QUEST HEROES: The World Tree’s Woe and the Blight Below comes to PlayStation®4 as a full scale, real time, action RPG in the storied franchise. Created in cooperation with Ω-Force (Omega Force) from KOEI TECMO GAMES, the title also brings together series luminaries including Yuji Horii, general director and creator of DRAGON QUEST, Akira Toriyama, the world-renowned artist who gave the series its signature visual style, and Koichi Sugiyama, the composer of its countless masterpieces.

Story
When a dark shockwave sweeps through the city of Arba, the monsters that once lived alongside the people in peace are driven into a frenzied rage. As either the hero Luceus or the heroine Aurora, the player joins forces with a cast of fan favorites from previous DRAGON QUEST titles, such as Alena, Bianca and Yangus, to bring the rampaging hordes of monsters to their senses and restore order to the kingdom.

Source: The Game Website.

174132.name: Smash & Grab: A Two-Person Job
174132.description:
Smash & Grab: A Two Person Job is a cooperative two-player game where you're charged with organizing the heist of well-guarded treasures.

In Smash & Grab, you choose a location to pull off your heist, choose 2 of 6 possible characters to perform the heist with, and then alternate revealing new events that occur during the heist and playing actions to a timeline in order to get in, grab the loot, and get out.

The game centers around resource management. Every round, a card from the event deck will be played to the timeline, which will increase the 'bad' resources (threat, fatigue, and setbacks) and limit your ability to gain the 'good' resource (progress). Then, players will take turns playing a card to the timeline to counteract these 'bad' resources while gaining as much progress as possible.

Each player has a hand of general action cards and starts the game with 3 powerful character-specific actions. Each action card adds or subtracts one or several resources, as well as sometimes giving the player access to powerful abilities such as looking through the action or event decks.

The resources are kept track of on shared boards. Each minute of the timeline has a threat track to keep track of the amount of threat you have minute-to-minute. Additionally, there is a progress and fatigue mat that is used in combination with specific tokens to keep track of your current totals for those resources.

If you are able to accumulate enough progress while keeping threat and fatigue low enough before you run out of space on the timeline or the event deck runs out, then you win.

174134.name: Conquered Armies: Rules for a Pathfinder Science Fiction Campaign
174134.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conquered Armies: Rules for a Pathfinder Science Fiction Campaign provides modifications and additions to the Pathfinder core system to play a science fiction campaign set in the Conquered Armies universe. Combined with Conquered Armies Campaign: Aliens, Empires and Industry, this material allows players to run characters as mercenaries, merchants, pirates (or both), or to explore systems in a galaxy in turmoil after the First Galactic War.
An experienced GM can develop a campaign arc based on any combination of the above material, but since the rules are designed to allow great flexibility, the GM will need to plan ahead!

174135.name: Conquered Armies Campaign: Aliens, Empires, and Industry
174135.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conquered Armies Campaign: Aliens, Empires and Industry provides information on over 50 star systems, hundreds of planets, 4 empires (and one independent system), over 30 ship types, and stats for 15 alien races.
Designed to be used with Conquered Armies: Rules for a Pathfinder Science Fiction Campaign, this material gives the basic details of Gold Sector in the Conquered Armies universe. The information provided in this book will allow an experienced GM to develop a campaign arc with myriad options for the players.

174136.name: Arrghh Bottom Sound: Core Rules, Campaign Setting and 14 Scenarios
174136.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pirates, Norse Deities, magic, wanton elves, Cthulhu, and rum in the Southwest Pacific!

If that doesn’t do it…I mean, a fantasy RPG with actual rules for sailing ships that can allow you to run an encounter in less than 37 hours? Adventures starting at Rick’s in the thriving seaport of Tenaru on Guadalcanal? An actual game mechanic for the players that just have to hit on the elf serving wench? Zombies invading Savo Island and only YOU can stop them? 15 minutes to create a character? This is why you started playing RPG’s. Come home. Enjoy.

This is the complete game, rules for character creation, a Campaign setting and scenarios with numerous beasts and a few elf maidens- with illustrations by Zarathul. A fantasy RPG where one moment your character can shout 'Avast ye scurvey dogs!' and in the next bring the cannon round to blast a Shoggoth coming over the rail back to the abyss.

174137.name: Munda: West New Georgia Map
174137.description:
From publisher blurb:

A map for the western side of New Georgia centered on Munda, one of the two major cities on New Georgia, for use with the Arrghh Bottom Sound RPG. This is part of the New Georgia campaign setting being slowly prepared for release. Interesting aspect to this, for those of you who like mysteries, I searched the internet but could not find any information on the mountains of Rendova. I creatively referred to the tallest mountain on Rendova as "Mount Rendova" for want of a better name so if anyone finds anymore information- such as the name of the mountains- I would enjoy hearing from you. Barring that, if you want a mountain or other part of the landscape named after you or someone you love, glad to include it on one of the next maps for much less than naming a star after yourself (as in 'free').

174138.name: North East New Georgia
174138.description:
From publisher blurb:

A map for the Northeastern side of New Georgia centered on Hovoro, one of the two major cities on New Georgia, for use with the Arrghh Bottom Sound RPG. This is part of the New Georgia campaign setting being slowly prepared for release, the ultimate goal is to have the entire island chain mapped and named in a 'one mile to the hex' layout, with a booklet of details on the towns, cities and locations of interest to accompany it. This is a free download for those who would like a larger map for printing/campaign use while patiently waiting for the complete product to come out. Note that this map can connect to the original Munda map (it's slowly coming together!)

174139.name: Introductory Rules for Ships: Crews, Combat, and Trade
174139.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pirates, Norse Deities, magic, wanton elves, Cthulhu, and rum in the Southwest Pacific!

If that doesn’t do it…I mean, a fantasy RPG with actual rules for sailing ships that can allow you to run an encounter in less than 37 hours? Adventures starting at Rick’s in the thriving seaport of Tenaru on Guadalcanal? An actual game mechanic for the players that just have to hit on the elf serving wench? Zombies invading Savo Island and only YOU can stop them? 15 minutes to create a character? This is why you started playing RPG’s, come home and enjoy.

Of course since this is free it is not the complete game, just an introduction with the rules for sailing ships and a couple of scenarios, hopefully enough that combined with the blurb above you will be excitedly checking DriveThruRPG or our Facebook Page to make sure you are one of the first purchasers when the full game is released in PDF on or around March 20th, 2014 with the print version following as quickly as I can arrange the layout work. In the meantime give these rules a try with your current fantasy RPG, it won't be quite the same but hey, any time you can work 'Avast ye scurvey dogs!" into a night's game, it's all good.

174140.name: Arrghh Bottom Sound Supplemental Material
174140.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is game related flavor background material but in the form of a short story with a couple of monster descriptions and stats. This posting via the Conquered Armies website is an effort to use this material that was deemed far too adult oriented to fit into the game as it has finally evolved. It came from a project related to “Arrghh Bottom Sound”, a Role Playing Game(RPG) that I worked on and the original thought was for a more adult type game but as that did not develop and not wanting this story and the work to go to waste I was able to obtain permission from the game designer to post the material here. Arrghh Bottom Sound is a standard fantasy RPG, this story is just an adaption from the Siren scenario with 7 illustrations (4 previously used and 3 new color) and also the stats and description with two illustrations (new) of the ‘Gregarious Shrub’ monster, a sentient plant that seduces and then devours its victims, written by yours truly with art by Zarathul and presented here with the permission of the game designer and author.

174141.name: Guadalcanal North Shore Map
174141.description:
From publisher blurb:

The map for the north shore of Guadalcanal. This includes the settings for several scenarios as well as room for some home designed adventures.

174142.name: Munda: Parara and Surrounding Islands
174142.description:
From publisher blurb:

A map for the western side of New Georgia focusing on Parara and some of its surrounding islands, for use with the Arrghh Bottom Sound RPG. This is part of the New Georgia campaign setting being slowly prepared for release- and due to techonology limitations (me more than the computer) the massive 'one mile to the hex' map of the New Georgia islands will eventually appear, first by one segement at a time maps such as this, then (please, hopefullly) a full map with all the cities, towns and other features for the campaign setting. The names are drawn from a variety of sources, it seems the World War II names have been mostly replaced with other titles, plus a few fanciful insertions by me, so while the map is reasonably accurate for the loaction don't be too shocked to discover variations, this is intended for use in a fantasy RPG and not as an accurate representation of the islands at any one time in their history.

174143.name: The Highway O' Death Module
174143.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Arrghh Bottom Sound Game Module Highway O' Death, set in the Great Dividing Range of Australia with Gnoll legions, Doom vultures and the jolly monks of Mount Barney Abbey and their superlative Halfling Ale- all part of a battle that could spell the end of civilization unless your characters swig some rum at Fort Zinderneuf, unsheath their Swords and with Odin's blessing charge forth to save the day!

174144.name: Mit Riesenspaß zum Riesenrad
174144.description:
This game takes place in a fairground. Your goal is to bring all your four pawns in the gondola of the ferris wheel. The first player who accomplishes this wins.

The board is build up of 12 double-sided tiles which are placed on the empty spaces at the beginning of the game.

Every turn, a player rolls the dice and moves one of his pawns. If the pawn lands on a red field the Player may take an empty tile and place it with any side on a free space on the board.

174145.name: The Highway O' Death Module Players Guide
174145.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Arrghh Bottom Sound Game Module Highway O' Death, set in the Great Dividing Range of Australia with Gnoll legions, Doom vultures and the jolly monks of Mount Barney Abbey and their superlative Halfling Ale- all part of a battle that could spell the end of civilization unless your characters swig some rum at Fort Zinderneuf, unsheath their Swords and with Odin's blessing charge forth to save the day!

174146.name: Batman: Road Trip
174146.description:
Gotham City's most heinous criminals are on the loose! As The Dark Knight, the city's sworn protector, you must race to defeat Two-Face, Penguin, Riddler and Joker before it's too late! Exciting game of strategy includes character pieces, score cards, action cards, dice, Batarang tokens, evidence tokens, and more.

Travel through Gotham City collecting information on the villains master plan. Carry out board actions, collect Batarangs, and acquire checkpoint toll passes while dishing out hard justice in thug battles. Gain access to criminal controlled roads that lead to villain strongholds in your search of evidence. Return the evidence to your Batcave for analysis to help you foil their sinister plot. The first person to complete their score card by acquiring 4 unique evidence pieces and return them to their Batcave is the winner.

boardgamecompilation: King of New York Promo Cards
174147.description: You can cancel (destroy building) of a Monster in the same borough as you. For each (destroy building) canceled, take 1 damage and gain 1 (star).
174147.name: King of New York: New York City Defender

174148.description: At the start of your turn, if you have fewer than 3 (hearts), heal 2 damage.
174148.name: King of New York: Nano Bots

174149.description: If you roll 4 of a kind, gain 1 (star) in addition to their effect, +1 (star) for each additional identical die.
174149.name: King of New York: Force of Unnature

boardgamecompilation: King of New York Promo Cards
174150.description:
Buy this card for 1 (energy) less if you are in MANHATTAN.

+ 5 (stars) if you are the Monster with the single fewest (stars).
174150.name: King of New York: U.N. Head Quarters

174151.description:
Buy this card for 1 (energy) less if you are in MANHATTAN.

+ 3 (stars). If this card is discarded without having been bought, all Monsters lose 3 (stars).
174151.name: King of New York: Trump Tower

174152.description:
A promotional card from the 2015 International TableTop Day kit.

This promo introduces a new character to play with in your game, as well as a Cardboard Standee and Crossroads Card that you can use in the game.
174152.name: Dead of Winter: Felicia Day
boardgameexpansion: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game

174153.name: Cinematic Dungeon Crawl
174153.description:
from the designer

A cinematic OSR, where you get experience by acting stupid.

174154.name: WWII Assault: Tactical Skirmish Combat
174154.description:
WWII Assault is a miniatures based war game for two or more players that recreates the gritty man-to-man combat of WWII. This game focuses on the small unit tactics used by fire teams and infantry squads emphasizing their differing weapons, training and determination. The unique mechanics in WWII Assault make it an intense action oriented game in which the battle can change in an instant.

Each player typically controls a squad or several squads of infantry. Each figure in WWII Assault is individually based and represents a single soldier that can perform independent actions from the rest of the squad.

WWII Assault is designed to allow players to recreate any small scale engagements from the first battles in Poland, throughout the European Theatre and into the last days of Berlin.

The WWII Assault Field Kit is a digest sized tri-fold rules booklet with an interior pocket that is packed with all the rules, weapon sheets, squad cards and more that you need to get started playing the game. There are two scenarios included in the Field Kit and more will be added to our website along with squad creation rules.

Players may use any scale of figures (suggested figure sizes range from: 15mm to 54mm) in their collection.

With the basic rules kept to under 5 pages, WWII Assault is quick and easy to learn and yet it offers:


A unique card-based initiative system that changes each turn.
A game system where higher skilled soldiers fire better than lesser skilled soldiers.
A game system where the differences between weapons not only exist but they are integral to the game.
A game system that can be realistically and enjoyably used in any squad level scenario from WWII.
A game system that tracks multiple levels of wounds, morale, suppression and other unit impairing conditions on the battlefield.


All this and more in an intense action oriented game where a single soldier can bring you total victory or drive you towards defeat.

174155.description:
Lignum is a game about the logging industry in the 19th century. As a woodcutter, your task is to prevail against your competitors and collect the most money after two years. Lignum (Latin for "wood") is a game for lovers of complex strategy games. After cutting and transporting your wood, don't think your job is finished. You'll still have to optimize your entire processing chain - and have fun doing it!

Each of the eight rounds always begins with the cutting of trees. If your supply lines are set up and the timber has been approved for felling, then the players claim an area using secretly selected cards. Since each of the areas contain differing amounts of food and wood, players must learn to recognize and adapt to their opponent's strategies because if two players are both in the same area, they must share the resources. Players continue to move along their supply route, using the marketplace to trade tools and food as well as recruit workers.

The players have to decide how their wood will be transported to their lumberyards (by raft, by foot, or in the winter by sled), if the wood should be dried or be processed immediately, and when the wood should be sold. The player must also think about new acquisitions (such as saws, sleds and pasture land) and fulfill orders to sell the wood. Because in the end, this business is all about money, and whoever can make the most wins.
174155.name: Lignum
boardgamepodcastepisode: clp022 – Lignum
Episode 81 -- Eating Cake in Bellevue (Part B, the Second)
Episode 83 -- All Ramshackle and Worry Free
Heavy Cardboard Episode 41 – Lignum
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
The Good The Board and The Gettin’ Capped: Episode 85 “Interview with Clay of Capstone Games”
WDYPTW Conversation Thing Ep 93.12

174156.name: Crate Packing Simulator 2015
174156.description:
Welcome to Loot Crate's first original board game! The goal is simple: be the first player to have all 5 items in your crate!

This is a roll and move game. As the players move around the board, they can land on spaces to allow them to get a piece of loot, or challenge another player to a duel using rock, paper, scissors dice! The first player to get each of the five types of loot in their crate wins.

174157.name: Masters of Disguise
174157.description:
In Masters of Disguise, players are spies playing and collecting different Spy Gear to add to their Spy Set, and trying to discover the identity of their opponents. This face-up set of Spy Gear cards can score points for that spy, but it can also elude to that spy's true identity! Once you think you know the Identity of another spy, you can make a guess to potentially unmask that spy...but look out, unmasked spies can fight back!

At the beginning of each round, players are given a secret Spy ID card that lets that player know which five Spy Gear cards (of 12 different Spy Gear cards) they are able to score with.

Each turn, spies draw a card from the Spy Gear deck, then play a card to their face-up Spy Set. Once they have added a new card to their Spy set, they must do one of three things:
• Swap any card in their Spy Set for any card in another's set.
• Destroy one of their own Spy Gear cards from their set to use it's ability.
(This can be asking other spies questions, or increasing their own score.)
• Guess the Identity of another spy.
(Add points to your total for correct guesses, and subtract points if incorrect)

If you are incorrect with your guess, you do not eliminate yourself.
If you are discovered, you are considered "unmasked".

Unlike many other elimination games, Masters of disguise doesn't REALLY eliminate players. unmasked spies can still swap spy gear cards around the table, and make guesses on other spies, so "eliminated" spies are still engaged throughout each round.

The player with the least total points between rounds will be the first player of each new round.

Rounds end when there is one undiscovered spy remaining. The player with the most points at the end of three rounds is the Master of Disguise!

174158.name: Chicago Enforcer
174158.description:
User Summary

In Chicago Enforcer, you gun your way through the streets of Chicago as Jimmy "Machine Gun" DeMora, an ambitious enforcer working for Al Capone during Prohibition. The game features a variety of gangster weapons and has a variety of items to unlock. The game supported Xbox Live and allowed for multiplayer action with up to 8 players.

174159.name: Owata-shi no haraguro shicho
174159.description:
User summary:
オワタ市の腹黒市長 (Owata-shi no haraguro shicho) is game from the Japanese doujin circle Hiruyumedo. In English, 'Owata-shi no haraguro shicho' means 'Evil Mayor Of A Hopeless Town'.

This is a game with the theme of a rigged mayor election and corruption along with an identity-hiding mechanism; and unbalanced team competition. The overall flow is similar to The Resistance, but the voting system is different, and the winner of each round is kept a secret. The team that gains more points at the end wins.

Publisher summary:
不均等の正体隠匿によるチーム戦で、市長選挙および汚職をテーマにしています。全体の流れはレジスタンス(Resistance)に近いですが、投票対象が異なり、ラウンドの勝敗は不明確です。
二つのチームでより多くの点数を稼いだほうが勝利です。

174160.name: Yaoguai
174160.description:
Evil has seeped into the land. The malevolent Yaoguai, a demon of great power, has escaped its celestial prison. Now it stalks the land, seeking its true enemy: Sun Wukong, the monkey king. Xuanzang, the wise teacher of Sun Wukong, has given his student his toughest trial: destroy the demon for good.

Sun Wukong has brought with him many fierce heroes and monks. But the beast's corruption runs deep, bringing other creatures and demons in its wake; and not all of the monkey king's soldiers can be trusted.

Players draw and play cards from hand, simulating the conflict between the various entities in the game. The goal is to capture the correct combination of cards, or the highest overall point value, while attempting to maintain some degree of secrecy.

Yaoguai is a game for 2-4 people that is playable in 5-10 minutes. Influences for the game are Seiji Kanai's Love Letter, as well as Chinese literature and mythology.

NOTE: The images associated with this game are prototype images. All art is used for example only.

NEWS! Check out the New Graphic Art post in below to see the new graphic design! And Version 2.0 of the PnP is now available!

This game is an entry in the Geekway to the West and BGG Micro game contest! Go here to vote for your favorites: https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/186510/item/3760563#item3...

174161.description:
From his youngest days, Tomrick loved throwing the bones. Four-sided, six-, eight-, tens-, even the dreaded twelve-siders... it didn't matter, so long as there was something to win or lose. Tomrick's problem came when his magical talents emerged. Suddenly, the dice had never thrown so well. Suspiciously well, in fact, and poor Tomrick's gambling days had come to an end. But all was not lost. After long study and many thousands of games played at the University's Causality Tower, Tomrick has emerged as the foremost Diceomantic authority in Arcadia (and gained a near encyclopedic knowledge of every game of chance known to mankind). No longer is Tomrick's good fortune restricted to just rolling dice. Why, his Grand Unified Gaming Theory posits that every living thing in the entire world is caught up in one great game, and that if you know the rules well enough, then you know just enough to break them in your favor.

The Tomrick expansion was a reward given out during the 2015 Dice Tower Kickstarter.
174161.name: Arcadia Quest: Tomrick

174162.name: Odious Lists
174162.description:
In Odious Lists, players have a limited time to come up with answers to outrageous, irreverent, and offensive prompts... with all answers for a given round starting with the same letter of the alphabet. Points are only awarded for unique answers - with extra points for the funniest answers - so you'll have to be creative AND dirty. Which we're sure comes naturally to you given your sordid past.

The prompts have gone through multiple rounds of edits based on feedback from literally hundreds of play-testers. Our goal has been to determine the prompts that best allow players to come up with hilarious answers. To give you an idea of what we mean, here are a few of the prompts from the game:


I'd never date someone who is [blank]
Things you do when you're blackout drunk
Things found on the set of a porno shoot
Fox News claims that welfare recipients spend taxpayer money on [blank]
Words or phrases that could describe a sexually transmitted infection
The BuzzFeed piece "26 Ways to [Blank] Yourself" changed my life


Odious Lists comes with six sets of lists, several packets of blank sheets, six pens, a timer, and an alphabet die.
Each game comes with six sets of lists, with 24 different lists in each set

174163.name: Ouroboros Dragons
174163.description: You are a legendary Ouroboros Dragon circling the earth with your tail. You keep moving forward, changing or consuming your opponents tails (and sometimes even their heads.) Create an unbroken tail of your color around the earth or be the last dragon left to win the game.

174165.description: This vampire and zombie themed promo mini-expansion for Professor Pugnacious adds 13 new cards - 12 zombie cards, and a new finale, Vampyr.
174165.name: Professor Pugnacious: Armies of the Undead

174166.description: This industrial revolution themed promo mini-expansion for Professor Pugnacious adds 5 cards - 1 new event, and 1 new class (4 cards), Captain of Industry.
174166.name: Professor Pugnacious: Age of Industry

174167.description: This detective themed promo mini-expansion for Professor Pugnacious adds 5 new cards - 1 new finale, Criminal Mastermind, and 1 new class (4 cards), Great Detective.
174167.name: Professor Pugnacious: Great Detectives

174168.name: Old Dogs
174168.description:
Publisher Blurb

You lift the iron, feeling the weight of it in your hand. Familiar but distant, dusty memories starting to stir.

The air tears at your lungs, the forest rushing past, feet and arms pumping as the skis carve the snow; muscle remembering, but protesting after all this time.

Your arm describes a wide arc; eyes rushing over the surface, measuring, placing. A bit of wobble in the line, but every new stroke is a little more confident.

Why did you even stop doing this to begin with?

Oh, yes…

In this game poem, you portray old friends who have come together after a long time. You used to meet to do something. You were good at it, but as time went by, you stopped. Now it is time to shake the dust off your old skills.

174169.description:
It is time to bring together your own Geek Army and take over the world (game night) in this 3 - 5 player, simple and fun card drafting game.

Many of us were picked on at school, many were last to be pick for sports and many want to take over the world. Well the fight back starts here! Recruit from the Internet, pick who to keep and who to pass on. Some will fall in the upcoming battle, but if you bring together the ultimate Geek Army, you will take over the world (game night). Come the GEEK REVOLUTION!

Your job is to build the best geek army you can. The player who wins the game gets to use their new geek powers (meta game effects like picking who makes drinks, or what game the group plays next.) You might want to play again just so you don't have to make the drinks for the rest of the event.
174169.name: Geek Army

174170.name: Picture Posers
174170.description:
Party Game. Each guest is given a card. The card is split into 3 different competitions.

1st: Place Names. A montage of 24 illustrations is given. Players must pair them off into pairs that represent the name of a town. Thus, 12 towns in all.
2nd: Words. Similar to the first competition but this time representing 'dictionary' words.
3rd: Silhouettes. There are nine pictures in silhouette and they must be identified.

Up to 12 can play. The host must set a time-limit and when "Time" is called, the guest with the most correct answers wins (and a good host or hostess should have a small gift as the winner's trophy).

174171.name: Spot the Twins
boardgameversion: Party Games Publishers orange surround edition
Party Games Publishers yellow surround edition
174171.description:
Party Game.

24 cards are placed around the room and guests are encouraged to play the game. Each card shows a spectacularly ugly man and, at first glance, seem the same but they are not. In fact, there are 12 matching pairs and so it becomes a game of observation.

The host or hostess announces the start of the game and players must rush to complete their list. The first guest to find all 12 pairs correctly, wins. The host or hostess should have a small prize for the winner.

174172.name: Dryad
174172.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

174173.name: Winter Wilderness Locations
174173.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable geomorphic battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: Four 10x10 battlemaps (plus extra level)

Empty Watch Tower - a two storey stone tower with space for 2 guards or soldiers
Ruined Statue - the head of a colossal statue, left to break down in the wilderness
Blood Trails - a splash of blood in the snow, with a trail leading into the trees
Ice Temple - a small temple with a magical ice flame burning on an altar




Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and gridless versions. (n.b. gridless version only in jpeg format)

174174.name: Ultimate Knights Templar Guide (Savage Worlds)
174174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone who has ever played a fantasy tabletop RPG has heard of the holy warriors known as paladins. Paladins are holy knights that wade into battle armed with sword, shield, and faith. They obediently go wherever they are needed to protect the faith and serve the faithful. They have great martial prowess and potent faith-based powers. In many games, paladins also observe a strict chivalric code while maintaining vows of poverty and chastity.

However, paladins aren't simply the stuff of legends. In actuality, paladins were very real. Following the First Crusade, knights banded together to serve the needs of the faith and the faithful. They lived the life of a monk while simultaneously following the path of a warrior. These warrior-monks formed a highbred of monastic life that was termed Military Orders. The most famous of these orders was the Knights Templar.

Ultimate Knights Templar Guide is a sourcebook for Savage Worlds that delves into the world of the Knights Templar from a historical and in-game aspect. The Knights Templar were the ultimate paladins during the Crusades who fought tooth and nail to reclaim the Holy Land. Their Order was shrouded in conspiracy and all of this results in excellent role-playing opportunities.

Ultimate Knights Templar Guide includes:

A brief history of the Knights Templar.
Ranks of Templar knights.
A listing of grand masters.
Options for creating Templar characters.
Gear utilized by the Knights Templar.
Non-player Characters.
Templar adventures.
... and more!




Ultimate Knights Templar Guide is your source for building Templar knights like those from the Crusades, or building the foundations of an alternate history set in the backdrop of the Crusades and the struggles to reclaim the Holy Land.

174175.name: Among the Trojans
174175.description:
From publisher blurb:

Among the Trojans presents a complete and self-contained game setting for Traveller. It can be placed in almost any star system without affecting a setting’s canon data on what is there. A wealth of adventure opportunities awaits within the Trojan zones of the gas giant Kendelsei, among her moons, and on the system’s outer planets.

Characters do not need a starship to adventure in this environment; it is possible to move between the moons and planetoids by local craft, hitching a ride with friends or paying for passage as necessary. An adventuring group that has the use of a small craft like a cutter or a ship’s boat will find this more than sufficient to give access to the many adventure locations in this sourcebook, though long transits aboard small craft are rarely very pleasant!

174176.name: Black Feats
174176.description:
From publisher blurb:

Black Feats is a consolidation, revision and clarification of the many strange powers available to the heroes and horrors of the Black Tokyo Campaign Setting.

This sourcebook presents feats in a modified format that should make them easier for players to choose from, as well as for myself and other designers to utilize in stat blocks and adventure design. Within you’ll find (almost) every feat from core sourcebooks like Races of the Tatakama and Black Tokyo Unlimited, as well as feats from secondary sourcebooks like Expanded Races: Kami, among many others. You’ll also find dozens of completely original feats, some building on previous work, others designed to take the campaign in new directions.

In addition, you’ll find a collected and fully revised list of starting traits for Black Tokyo’s adventurers. As with the feats, these traits are culled from a variety of sources mixed together with new traits, from mundane talents like expertise in adult video fetish photography to mastery of Akihabara’s electrical sorcery.

Black Feats is broken into several subheadings. The first five sections of the book detail the different kinds of character traits: Combat, Faith, Magic, Racial and Social traits, in that order. The sixth section details Birthright Feats, which can only be chosen by first level heroes. Finally, Other Feats details all the other feats available to heroes and villains alike.

174177.description:
Most Glorious Comrade is a light card game with variable player powers in which 2-6 players are vying for the affections of the Proletariat.

Comrades (players)start the game by choosing who is the Greatest Comrade (first player) based on clothing and knowledge of Communist buzzwords.

Comrades choose one of six leaders: Lenin, Stalin, Mao, Trotsky, Castro, and El Che.

Comrades start with one card in their hand.

Every turn, Comrades draw 1 card and play 1 card.

The first Comrade to 10 Million Proletariat wins. Proletariat cards are distributed from 1 Million to 4 Million. Good luck, Comrade!
174177.name: Most Glorious Comrade

174178.name: Holterdipolter
174178.description:
Huia Walpurgisnacht: at long last, it finally has arrived!

It has been for weeks that the big and little witches and sorcerers have waited for the most beautiful night of the year: the Walpurgisnacht!
Only in this crazy night the Blocksberg releases his biggest secret: the stones of wisdom.
The stones rumble trough an extensive and mysterious cave system in front of the many cave entrances.
In front of those, the witches or sorcerers are waiting to get one of those precious stones.
Because it is so dark the witches and sorcerers have to lean on their hearing. The cat will help with the search, thanks to its good eyes!
Who will hear the most stones this time?
Train your hearing and concentration skills. An unusual game for the whole family.

This is how it is played:
One player will release a stone within the Blocksberg-gorge (abyss), which will then rumble his way down trough a mysterious maze.
So then, open your ears, because you won’t see where the stone is going!
After the stone has reached his goal every players throws his dice and moves the cat to the witch or sorcerer on which he thinks the stone has fallen.
The cave entry will then be opened.
If the player has listen carefully he can take the stone.
If the player is wrong, the other players will try to get the stone.

174179.name: Flotsam
174179.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 241st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a beach with shipping containers washed ashore.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

174180.name: Sopio
174180.description:
The points and puns card game arrives on iOS! Play Sopio anywhere, even if you don’t have any friends!

Get to 1000 points to win before your opponents!

Play cards on yourself! Play cards on them! Play cards on no-one and just enjoy the pictures!

Enjoy a game of Sopio against real computer opponents, featuring cards from Sopio Deck 1:

- Protect yourself with a Snazzy Helmet!
- Survive an encounter with a Joyless Bear!
- Turn another player into a Wombat!
- See the future in your Crystal Bowling Ball!
- Watch out for the Evil Spider!

Unlock two booster packs and 18 unique opponents with your skill. Or your money. Or just dumb luck.

Share your victories with digital friends via Facebook and Twitter!

Source: The Developer Website.

174181.description:
User Summary:

Princess Escort is a game of cooperation and betrayal. As the Escort Army, it is the players' duty to keep the princess secure on her way to a castle. During their travels, they have to cooperate to deal with several monsters attacking them.

To make matters worse, one or two of the players are the Rebels who secretly help the monsters and try to harm the princess. The Escort Army must also protect her from the Rebels.

Player actions are performed by secret voting, so even if the princess was harmed, the players don't know who did it. Players should deduce and discuss to identify who the Rebels are.
After the 7-day travel, if the princess arrives at the castle alive, the Escort Army wins.

User summary:
プリンセスエスコートは、協力と裏切りのゲームです。
プレイヤーは護衛軍として、姫を安全に城まで護衛する任務についています。道中で襲撃してくるさまざまなモンスターに、協力して対処しなければなりません。
さらに、プレイヤーの中には反乱軍の一員がいて、ひそかにモンスターを助けたり、姫に危害を加えようとします。反乱軍からも姫を守らなければなりません。
各プレイヤーの行動は、秘密投票で行われ、姫に危害が及んだときでも、誰がやったかはわかりません。プレイヤーは、推論や議論によって誰が反乱軍かを割り出していきます。
7日間の旅を終え、姫が無事に城にたどり着けたら護衛軍の勝利です。

Publisher summary:
お姫様を護りながらお城まで送り届ける事を目的としたゲームです。道中様々な魔物が襲ってきます。「護衛軍」となったプレイヤーは、お姫様を護るため、力を合わせ「会話」をし「投票」を行いお姫様を護ります。
174181.name: Princess Escort

174182.description:
In ancient times, there was a land where Gods and Demons would wage war. A land that was graced by the five Elements, Valhalla. After a long period of time, the fighting never ceased, and would repeat itself time after time. Soon enough, the war itself would involve the people living in Valhalla.

The Gods and Demons would then develop techniques to summon and reincarnate strong, radiant souls, into battlers and soldiers to aid them in their cause.

A whisper was heard... "In exchange for your soul, I shall bestow upon you power unimaginable..." In order to pave a new path to a brighter future, people gathered, and made pacts (Judgement) that would grant them new powers.

Those who fight for their own beliefs, those who fight for the Gods, those who fight against the Gods, their spirit drives them into battle, and the battle has just begun.

Game Play
Players select a Ruler, which represents them in the game, and build a deck of cards around this ruler. You also have a separate deck of 10-20 Magic Stone cards.

During your turn you draw cards from your deck and play different types of cards to the field of play, interacting with your and your opponent's cards:

Magic Stones: Cards that produce Will which you use to pay the cost of other cards.
Resonators: Creatures you summon to help you in battle to defeat your opponent.
Spells: They allow a player to support their Resonators with various effects, or hinder their opponent's Resonators.
Additions: Enchantments or Enhancements to augment their own Resonators or weaken opposing Resonators.





Objective of the Game:
1. Lower the opponent players life from 4000 to 0 by attacking them.
2. You also win if the opponent can't draw a card for the compulsory draw in the Draw Phase.
174182.name: Force of Will
boardgamepodcastepisode: Play 2016: le novità ludiche – Il Dado Incantato #5

174183.name: Argor Fantasy Role Playing Game
174183.description:
From publisher blurb:

Argor FRPG is a roleplaying game in the classic tradition of high fantasy.

It is designed to be an ideal introduction to RPGs for new players. The rule mechanics are straightforward: you only need six-sided dice, and you always aim to roll as high a score as possible. All the familiar elements of fantasy are here: orcs, elves, magic, dragons etc.

However, the game is also intended to have depths that will intrigue more experienced gamers. There are no character classes – instead a skill-based approach means players can create diverse characters who’s abilities progress with experience. The game world offers a wide range of different gaming experiences: a river-valley civilisation of rat people, war-loving lizard men who ride dinosaurs into battle, desert-dwelling serpent-folk and more besides.

While Argor FRPG features original rules, it is designed to offer more than that. The product comes complete with supporting resources that help create a vibrant gameworld atmosphere. The world of Argor is described in all its glory, with maps, a complete history and a gazetteer of locations. Even if you have your own preferred fantasy RPG rules, Argor FRPG will give you histories, languages, locations and plot hooks fit to grace any game.

174184.name: The Bale: Undead in Argor
174184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before the first orc drew breath, dark forces stalked the world of Argor. Even as the first of the Free Peoples explored their new lands, fell creatures, dread curses and dire plagues awaited them. Together, these abominations became known as The Bale.

This is a supplement to Argor FRPG that introduces the undead into Argor. There are full details on the seven Bale races:

Banshee
Deathwalker
Ghoul
Shade
Skeleton
Vampire
Werewolf




To even things up a little, there is also a section on the Creed of Anamordeus, magic users dedicated to cleansing Argor of the undead, with nine new spells and three new magic items for use in your scenarios.

174185.name: The GM's Planet-Building Handbook
174185.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, your sci-fi RPG campaign is going to span vast volumes of space and introduce new alien races from an exotic medley of planets. But just what are those planets like? This handbook will allow you to design realistic planets capable of bearing human (or human-like) life. Guidance is given on:

Host star
Planet orbit
Planet size
Axial tilt
Moons
Planet rotation
Magnetosphere
Geological activity
Atmosphere
Hydrosphere
Climate




Plus, there's a section on how to produce accurate maps of your planet.

The handbook is based on scientific principles, but don't worry, all the numbers have been crunched and distilled to a few easy-to-use charts and tables.

174186.name: Distant Vistas
174186.description:
From publisher blurb:

As an impressionable teenager I always loved the glossy hardback sci-fi books that seemed to abound in those days, telling of 'future histories' and featuring page after page of gorgeous airbrushed art work. Distant Vistas is a game resource in that style: science fiction told as fact, with plenty of illustrations thrown in the mix. The Sector described is far too large to describe in full - rather, Distant Vistas gives a flavour of it, with selected planets, cities, alien species, weapons and spacecraft described in detail... not to mention sports, culture, politics, religion and useful gadgets! I very much hope that Distant Vistas will be of use to sci-fi RPG GMs - that maybe the Player Characters in your next game will get to fire the I-47's plasma cannons in anger, or will sit down with a Kree for a game of Karanj (they should do well: very wise, the Kree, but terrible bluffers...).

174187.name: Arkadon Castle
174187.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arkadon Castle is a location resource for use in any fantasy/medieval RPG or skirmish wargame. Full details are given of a small fortified manor house (closely modelled on Aydon Castle in North East England). Plans are given on a variety of scales, including room plans suitable for use with miniatures.

You can either print-and-play immediately with the furnished room plans provided, or design your own using the unfurnished generic plans (we've even included a sheet of cut-out beds, chairs, tables, chests etc for you to use if you want).

Arkadon is by no means an impregnable fortress, but it's a good base for a scenario set in a dangerous region and a great location for a small battle.

174188.name: Dragon's Dogma Online
174188.description:
User Summary

Dragon's Dogma Online will feature a new storyline, characters and setting. A mystic white dragon, has been weakened due to unknown reasons and in order to restore itself, the white dragon seeks out scores of people, making them all Arisen to fight for it.

Item-based micro-transactions will be supported and groups can be formed in town-based lobbies that can hold up to 100 players.

174189.name: Dragon's Dogma Quest
174189.description:
User Summary

Dragon's Dogma Quest has a party of up to eight pawns who work through various dungeons that require strategic movements to find the best paths. There are various traps and other gimmicks to look out for.

174190.name: Goblin
174190.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

174191.name: A Little Bit of Thievery
174191.description:
From publisher blurb:
