There the players are tasked with leading their beloved heroes through a magical journey full of excitement and danger to save the Realms from the Dark Lords’ overwhelming hordes. Every hero is represented by a lovingly crafted miniature, already included in the box.
Bedtime Story continues to build on that legacy and brings four new realms: Tang Dynasty, Horrorville, Clockwork Shire and Atlantis. This time Heroes must destroy once and for all the Dark Forces! In Tang Dynasty a god has been born with unlimited power. Player begin their journey from the same realm and they must travel from one land to another but to do that they must destroy the Walls which separate each land. Each Wall has three parts and they can be destroyed by accomplishing different tasks: Find all Artifacts, destroy a Dark Lord or destroy the Black Fortress. When a part of the Wall is removed, the player who did wins some extra and new Talents: the Green ones. These Talents determine the vulnerability of the player at the end of the game. In each round archers on top of the wall attack and all players lose talents, making the game progressively more difficult! Things will become more challenging... As long as player try to destroy the Wall in a Realm, Invaders take over the rest Active Realms! When you get at the Palace, you must all face the god who born there and then one of you can take that power!

On the other other side of the fairy world, Atlantis is sinking and the flood affects all the rest active Realms. Each time you destroy Invaders the water level rise in more than one Realms and you need more Talents to travel there as for the Invaders, they become more powerful. Save as many people, sacrifice your character and buy some time trying to find the solution and save yourselves. The time is running but in Clockwork Shire there is no time. Pinocchio and Geppetto must work to find all the missing gear wheel and re-activate all the Areas and only then you can attack the Invaders who raid the Realm. Use speed, travel among all the realms and find the correct gear wheel but be careful! Steam Baron will be there and you must face his mechanical skills! Regroup your team, this war is not over yet. A madman is running loose in Horrorville, a doctor who transforms people into beasts. If he transforms them all, you lose, so you must work together and find the cure and then you must find this madman and cure him but he is way to strong!
174469.name: 12 Realms: Bedtime Story
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 76 - Listener Feedback, the Return!

174471.name: Skramplokremala
174471.description: Σκραμπλοκρεμάλα is a boardgame combination of two word games (scrabble and 'hangman game') creating a completely new and fun game!

174474.description:
DuploHex is a connection game, related to Hex, that includes disc and rings. In order to play DuploHex you need a 7×7 Hex board, 25 black and 25 white rings, and 25 black and 25 white discs.

White starts by placing one disc or ring on any cell of the board. Then, each player in turn must perform two actions: 1. add one of her discs to an empty cell or move one of her discs on the board into any ring located in a neighbor cell, and 2. add one of her rings to an empty cell or move one of her rings on the board to a neighbor cell occupied by a disc. The disc-ring pair (a disc inside a ring) cannot be modified for the rest of the game.

The game ends the moment that a player establishes a chain of her discs or rings connecting the two opposing sides of the board marked by her color.
174474.name: DuploHex

174475.name: Hunting Questions: For Children
174475.description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole world especially for children.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It extends a series of trivia games series: Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

174476.description:
10' to Kill is a deduction game for 2-4 players that's played in about ten minutes. There are 16 characters on the board, and each player secretly embodies one of them. Each player also has three secret targets they must eliminate, without being discovered. The players have two actions each turn from the following choices: move any character anywhere on the board, eliminate a character (different ways of doing this), or make an identity check by the police. The trick is that when a character is eliminated, nobody says by whom or how! You must apply yourself in blending your true hitman in a crowd of possible suspects, or guess which character is the hitman of the other players.

As time goes by in 10' to Kill, you will feel pressure and suspicion weigh on your shoulders. Ten minutes is a short time, but it can sometimes be very long when all eyes are on you! You'll have to bluff and use discretion to eliminate your targets...and maybe the competitor's hitman!

Are you ready to become the most prestigious hitman?
174476.name: 10' to Kill
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 006 – Top Kickstarter Games
Episode 2: Paris est Ludique 2015

174478.name: Earthdawn Player's Guide (4th Edition)
174478.description:
From the publisher's website:

An age of magic once existed in our world. Lost to history, this time is remembered in the echoes of myth and legend. Humans lived alongside the other Namegiver races—dwarf and elf, troll and ork, windling, t’skrang and obsidiman. The wild places of the world were home to griffins, shadowmants, and other fantastic beasts.

The land was once besieged by the Horrors, foul creatures from the depths of astral space that sought to feed upon and destroy all that was living and good. Their time—the time of the Scourge—has passed, and the people have returned to the surface, reclaiming the lands that were once their home.

Brave heroes band together to explore the land of Barsaive, fighting the Horrors that remain, and protecting their homes and families from those that would enslave them.

The Player’s Guide provides you with the rules for playing characters from First to Eighth Circle, with all the talents, spells, and other tools needed to forge your own legends in the Earthdawn Roleplaying Game!

The Fourth Edition is the newest version of the classic fantasy role-playing game. While this edition revises many of the existing rules systems, the core mechanics and assumptions remain the same. This edition also updates the game setting, advancing the timeline several years. Products using previous editions of the Earthdawn game can be used with Fourth Edition, but may require some conversion to be fully compatible.

174479.name: CRGE: Conjectural Roleplaying GM Emulator
174479.description:
From publisher blurb:

CRGE is a GM emulator that works on adding the unexpected to your imagination. CRGE is a tiered system to create a role-playing experience without a GM. At the base level the system works to answer "yes or no" questions while constantly pushing the game towards the unexpected. At the intermediate level, the system weaves story threads together to give each scene a focus in advancing a specific narrative. At the high level, CRGE provides frameworks to tell complete stories by yourself, with a group of friends, or even online.

Best of all CRGE is system and setting agnostic. It will overlay your favorite roleplaying games with ease.

174480.name: 17 Sailors
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
174480.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: 17 Sailors

If your player group finds itself on the high seas or in a port during World War II, you'll need to quickly populate the docks or decks with sailors. This deck gives you 17 to choose from, giving you everything from a captain to a cook!

174481.name: 17 Soldiers
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
174481.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: 17 Soldiers

Soldier of all sorts fought in World War II and if your player group is taking part in that struggle, they'll run across Allied soldiers. 17 Soldiers gives you a number of different fighters, from a Captain to a Bazooka Gunner and beyond!

174482.name: Robot Empire
174482.description:
Robot Empire is a strategy and battle card game set in a large space age universe where Robot armies battle it out for control of the galaxy. Use Super Weapons, Human Agents, Upgrade Components, Base Equipment, and Monster Mercenaries to wage your war. Power Management is crucial in the game as you will need to mine for Power Coins to obtain enough energy to run your empire.

The cards have beautiful and colorful imagery right out of 1950s science fiction. Players will easily get emerged into the genre of the game.

Game Play:
Each turn, players spend their Power Coins (earned by minting or mining or landing on Mining Moon cards)to bring out fighters like Robots or Monster Mercenaries that can attack opponent's. Building a strong Base (Base cards form the back row on tabletop) allows players to shoot Long Range Weapons, Use Force Fields for extra defense, and create Power Coins. Players can customize their draw decks to follow different strategies and playing styles. A player looses Life Points when attacking fighters are not blocked. When a player reaches zero Life Points, they are out of the game.

174483.name: To Build a Wonder
174483.description:
You are an Egyptian military foreman leading your workers to carry large boulders to the great pyramid Giza, one of the seven great wonders of the world.

Players cooperatively pull a giant boulder first to the pyramid, then up the pyramid to be set in place.

On your turn, you may choose two actions:


play a track card from your hand
give a clue to the other players
draw a card (usable only once per turn)


No matter the actions, the boulder moves one space further at the end of each player's turn.

All players win if they successfully pull the boulder and put it in place on the pyramid, players lose if the boulder ever falls off the track.

At game end, IF all players make it to the end, the player with the most cards in hand wins.

A microgame for the BGG / Geekway to the West design contest.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Premio Alfonso X Mejor Juego Nominee
174485.description:
Abstract strategy in ancient Babylon.

Choose your path wisely!
Each path will bring you different results and will condition your rivals' decisions.
As you leave a trail of water, every plant that you fully irrigate will award you precious nectar.
The nectar is the key to winning the favor of the goddess Ishtar and winning the game!

The rules of the game are really simple, in your turn:
1- Choose a path from the central well without using the same tile twice
2- Put a water gem in each tile in the path
3- Collect a nectar wink for each tile filled with as many water gems as flowers
4- Put that nectar wink in your scoreboard
5- Repeat the steps for each player until someone completes the scoreboard

Despite the simplicity, strategy can be quite deep, you'll have to consider:

Which tiles will give the next player an advantage if you add a water gem?
Which tiles are worth completing to mess with your rivals' strategy?
Which tiles are worth completing based in your position in the scoreboard?
Speed vs precision. Is it better to finish first or to get more points per wink?
174485.name: Babylon Gardens

174486.name: Samsaran Compendium
174486.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the ecology of the samsaran race with the Samsaran Compendium! From the designer who brought you the Kitsune Compendium, Pact Magic Unbound, and Guidance, the Samsaran Compendium gives players and GMs alike all of the resources they need to implement this witty, capricious race into their campaign setting. Within the Samsaran Compendium, you will find:

A detailed analysis of the samsaran race, including basic facts, ecology and psychology, culture, origin mythology, religion, and more.
Over a dozen alternate racial traits, including options that allow your samsaran to possess the heritage of another one of Pathfinder's Core Races.
3 new bardic performances that align with the origin mythos presented in the Samsaram Compendium.
The Reincarnation Mystery for oracles.
New character archetypes that allow characters, both samsaran and non-samsarans, to reflect samsaran ideals and culture in their class choices.
A list of rogue talents that allow a rogue to gain certain abilities that harken back to other classes.
And much, much more!

174487.name: Exotic Races #02: Fhall
174487.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting the Fhall, an all-new plant/animal hybrid race for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
Dwelling in the deep swamps live the fhall, bizarre creatures shunned by humanoid society due to their dependance on humanoid corpses to propagate.

Inside you'll find:

The fhall race, with alternate racial traits and favored class options.
The Flourish druid archetype.
Racial feats and spells, including the 9-level create shambler spells that allow you to create plant creatures to fight for you.
20 shamblers for creating witt the create shambler spells, or for use as standard monsters.

174488.name: Skull Cove
174488.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the distant reaches of the Dragon Isles lies a quiet cove, where friendly pirates welcome the Adventurers to their small settlement. But all is not as it seems - there is a dark secret behind the smiles of the inhabitants...

This adventure for Pirates & Dragons includes statistics for both the Renaissance and OneDice versions of the game, as well as retro-clone stats. It is intended to be used with the large scale colour map of Skull Cove presented by Dramascape. Both can be bought together - look for the discounted bundle!

Note: The Dramascape map package also contains a completely different take on the island, for the Savage Worlds system. Renaissance, OneDice and retro-clone stats are provided in this product for that adventure.

174489.name: Puppy Phonics
174489.description: Puppy Phonics is an educational game about consonant blends and short vowel sounds. It is designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, or 4 players age four and older. Each player twirls a spinner and names the sound indicated... for example, A E I O U. The player then advances his or her puppy token to the next space on the illustrated pathway which features an image matching that sound. The first player to reach the finish line is declared the winner.

174490.name: Le livre des Jeux de rôle
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
174490.description:
User summary:

This book is in French

This book about role playing games will provide in depth information on the hobby, be it for beginners, the curious or even academics.

It is centered around the the universe of role playing games in France in 1997. It has 4 parts


What are role playing games
Role playing games, a social phenomenon
For a smart practice of role playing games
The expert corner


At the end there is a short curated list of games, be they in French or in English.

This book was written by Didier Guiserix, the editor-in-chief of the leading French role playing game periodical Casus Belli.

174491.description:
In a place where politics, magic and science are covered in a heavy layer of coal dust lies the world of Steam Court. Steam Court is a 1–12 player card game that mixes elements of traditional trick-taking, with character based abilities and victory point win conditions.

Steam Court is a game of Victorian hierarchy where the more powerful your position, the greater your opportunity in the game. You'll want to try and hold onto the throne, but don't play your cards right and you'll end up serving the lousy Tea Boy. Each round, players rotate position at the table, and depending on their seat they gain/lose privileges. Even though the game is stacked in favor of those at the top, the luck of the deal, use of special cards, and player strategy are guaranteed to make it interesting.

There are multiple variations on how to play, but the typical game involves four rounds of cards and usually takes around 60 minutes.
The original artwork, intriguing theme, and clever game play will have you ratcheting for the top in Steam Court.

Goal: get rid of the cards in your hand before other players do. There are many strategies you can employ do this, but the most common is to be the controlling player to start the trick. The player who wins the trick starts the next trick. This allows you to decide how many cards of the same number you will play. Then all other players must match the quantity of cards played and also beat the number that is on the cards. For example, if a player lays three 1s, then the next player must lay three cards of a higher number - like three 2s or three 3s. What gives this game an extra dimension are the variable character privileges. Each Engineer is granted a different privilege by their Courtier that can be employed at the beginning of the Quarter or throughout the game. For example, the Duke can lay matching numbered cards instead of having to play higher numbered cards on a set of cards.

End of the Quarter: After everyone's cards have been played the Quarter ends and players re-seat based on the order they went out in (first player out becomes the Queen, and so on). They then gain the privileges of a different character for the next Quarter.

7-12 players: When playing with a large group a new element is added to the game -- a second table full of Renegades. Players who do poorly in the Royal Court are banished to the Renegade table, while the top two engineers at the Renegade Table are promoted to the Royal Court. In Steam Court, anything can happen. The lowest of low can climb to the top, or the Queen’s engineer can wind up working for the vagabond.
174491.name: Steam Court
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 22: Kemet Review - Ta-Seti Review

174493.description:
Two children have lost control of their pet Monsters. Help them collect these Monsters-on-the-loose. Find My Monsters is 2 fun and fast card games in 1.

In Game 1, the deck is shuffled, then spread out face down. Players decide who goes first. They each then take turns turning over two cards in order to match the Alfi card (Green Background) with one of his pet Monsters (Green Background), or the Penny card (Orange Background) with one of her pet Monsters (Orange Background). (Or vice versa – matching Monster to matching Alfi/Penny) The cards that match are then placed in front of you to form your Point pile. At the end of the game, players will add up the total Monsters in their Point pile, and the player with the most Monsters wins!

In Game 2, the deck is shuffled and placed between both players. Each player draws four cards, and then one person takes the top four cards of the deck and places them face up in a row next to it. Decide who goes first. During each of their turns, players will look at the cards in their hands and the cards face up next to the deck in order to pair up two cards, Penny to one of her Monsters or Alfi to one of his Monsters(or vice versa). Your goal is to put together the cards that add up to the highest value (using the numbers on the bottom right of each card). These cards are then placed in front of you to form your Point pile. At the end of the game, each player adds up all the numbers on all of the cards in their respective Point piles, and the player with the higher total wins!
174493.name: Find My Monsters

174494.description:
A new take on the deck-building genre, featuring the zany universe of the hit show Space Dandy as seen on ADULT SWIM.

That's right, baby! Dandy has gone and used the Aloha Oe's broken warp drive and managed to converge every possible alternate universe into one, causing multiple copies of everyone in the known galaxies to run amok! What does this mean for our intrepid heroes? Will all semblance of civilization fall into disorder and chaos? Will the universe, under the weight of so many simultaneous timelines, implode on itself into a cosmic Big Bang?

Well. Maybe. But for now it means the Alien Registration Center has reset the database and is allowing new registration of all previously registered aliens! That's cold, hard Woolong just out there for the taking, baby!

The Space Dandy: Galactic Deck-Building Game brings the bizarre space-faring antics of the hit anime series seen on ADULT SWIM TOONAMI to the game table. It's similar to other Deck-Builders like Dominion and Ascension—with an extra helping of phantom space ramen goodness. Each player begins the game with the same rather low-powered starting cards, but through careful play, you can acquire more to expand your options. Which cards you choose to take directly influence the kind of game you play!

Cards can grant new abilities, make it easier to acquire new cards, allow you to take extra turns, or even destroy cards from the game altogether! But the most important cards are the aliens. Not only can they improve your hand just like any other card, they can be played Planetside and directly attack the other Player. Why fiddle around endlessly with your deck when you can stick it to them and mess up their carefully laid plans? That's the Dandy way to play!

Even more importantly, aliens are how you win! When you register aliens, they are removed from play, but you get to score precious, precious Woolong that you need to win the game. But be careful! It can be difficult to decide if an alien is more useful in your hand, on the Planet, or in the Alien Registration Center's bank.

That’s not to say the other cards aren’t important, too! Effect Cards cannot be registered OR played Planetside, but they let you manipulate the game to your advantage. Sick of that really great card the opponent keeps playing? DESTROY IT! Changed your mind about the card you played Planetside? WARP IT BACK! Keep your opponent’s on their toes with your carefully constructed (or hazardously haphazard) deck!

You can also fill out your space crew with other humans (and the occasional robot) that can’t be registered as aliens (obviously). But never fear! They make up for the lack of Woolong delivery with unique abilities of their own!

So register those aliens, earn all the Woolong you can, and may the Best Dandy Win!
174494.name: Space Dandy: Galactic Deck-Building Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 003: Party time!

174495.name: Mini Bullets
174495.description:
From the publisher website:
Siete pronti a cavalcare verso il tramonto?
Sia che la vostra colt trami una vendetta da troppo tempo o che voglia assicurare alla legge dei malviventi, con questo gioco potrete rivivere le grandi avventure dei film western con una ironica connotazione in chiave fantasy!

English translation:
Are you ready to ride in the sunset?
Whether your Colt plot revenge for too long or you want to catch criminals, with this game you can live the great adventures of western movies with an ironic fantasy connotation!

174496.name: Mini Vampires
174496.description:
From the publisher website:
Qui si parla di maledizioni e punizioni gravissime. Come se l'essere un vampiro non fosse già una maledizione, ecco qui c'è in atto molto di più che il mero succhiare sangue...

English translation:
Here we talk about curses and serious punishments. As if being a vampire was not already a curse, here there is a lot more than the mere blood sucking...


Fourth game landed in the house Mini G4m3s Studio, but the first that does not use the usual regulation that was previously at the base of the other three. Here we talk about curses and punishments serious. As if being a vampire was not already a curse, here there is in place a lot more than the mere sucking blood ...
Why you ask? What's worse than sucking blood to survive? Vampires are not already cursed by sunlight? No because:

- After making common cause with the mortals,

- Shone as Dragqueen in sequined clothes and lived most insipid love stories of those of Dawson;

- Agreeing to be passed by the protagonists of novels horror protagonists of the stories of amorein style Harmony,

Nowadays find themselves reduced to a minimum. Is exact in every sense! Vampires from mighty predators are now ghettoized even insects and even mocked by most animals cute and cuddly ... This is the terrible fate that hit the so-called Mini Vampires, those survivors who have not surrendered, those who rebelled but living yet every day the horrible reality: the vampire myth has collapsed and now the fate of this ancient lineage of the damned is in their hands.

Your task is to try to grow, telling their wickedness to the detriment of others, obviously trying to shift the blame on others always. You will be quite sinister and treacherous as expected by tradition? Will our anti-heroes to return to their original size or succumb smoked by coils and pesticides until completely eclipsed by the hand of Shame?

On our Facebook page you can also find the strips Mini Vampires!

174497.name: Epées & Sorcellerie 2
174497.description:
User summary

This is the second édition of Epées & Sorcellerie, a retro clone game that allow you to experience the original 1974 game written by Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson.

It corrects the previous version, revamps the chapter about treasure, adds a thief class and two adventures.

The game is licensed under OGL.

174499.description: Trains: Map Pack 2 introduces an exciting, new, double-sided game board featuring a four-player map of Europe on one side and a pair of two-player boards on the other, including Italy and California.
174499.name: Trains: Map Pack 2 – Europe/Italy/California

174500.name: Alone Against the Flames
174500.description:
From the introduction:

This is a solo adventure for the Call of Cthulhu game. It is a horror story set in the 1920s where you are the main character, and your choices determine the outcome. It is also designed to lead you through the basic rules of the game in a gradual and entertaining fashion. Although most such adventures are played with your friends, this one is just for you.

Before you begin to play, make sure you have a copy of the Call of Cthulhu Seventh Edition Quick-Start Rules, and a blank investigator sheet. You can download a printable investigator sheet, or an interactive PDF version of the sheet, as well as the Quick-Start Rules from www.chaosium.com. You’ll also need a pencil, an eraser, and some roleplaying dice.

You don’t need to read the rules before you start playing. Just settle in a comfortable chair before a roaring fire. Then read on and follow the instructions.

…On second thoughts, don’t sit too close to the fire.

174001.description: The Solar Angel Auroniel is the competitive prize for Month 6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
174001.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Solar Angel Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174002.name: Space Lab
174002.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a small, primitive space laboratory.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

174003.name: Santa Cruz
174003.description: Santa Cruz is a simulation Wargame of WWII Carrier Combat, focusing on Japanese and United States forces in late October 1942. The game has both basic and advanced rules.

174004.name: D&D Avventure
174004.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre.
This monographic product collects three D&D adventures using the Mystara setting.

174005.name: The Pale Lady
174005.description:
From the publisher:

Deep in the woods—any woods and every woods— lives a witch known as the Pale Lady or the Flower Mistress. She isn’t a witch, but a faerie queen—an evil faerie queen. As you can imagine, the finer points of that distinction are lost on the peasant farmers who lose their children to her malicious ways. Her domain is sealed away most of the year, but every spring the veil between worlds is thin enough that the Pale Lady can send out her army of emaciated animal thralls to steal the sons of honest people.

174006.name: The Cat Box
174006.description: The Cat Box is both a card expansion for Box O'Cats or game of its own. The Cat Box game play is cat situations and cat-related items taken to the extreme. Can you placate your new catlike alien masters? Can you get a cat out of a tree using some cattails or a catapult? What if WE were shrunk to the size of cats? What if dogs and cats started a war? Can you solve these dilemmas with the items on the cards you hold in your hands?

174007.description:
Investing is designed to teach potential investors where is the best place to keep one's money under various economic conditions.

The game's main equipment is a standard fifty-two card deck. Each rank has been assigned a different type of investment. For example: aces represent retail stocks and tens represent silver. Each player gets five Business Trend Cards which let the players know each investment's value during the five possible economic conditions: recession, stability, depression, stagflation, and inflation.

To play the game, poker chips are distributed among the players equally. A die is rolled to determine the economic condition for this hand. Players proceed to play Draw Poker using the appropriate Business Trend Card to determine the value of one's own hand.

The instruction booklet gives the rules for four other variants of poker but all other poker variants could be played using this deck.
174007.name: Investing

174008.description:
Zoo Webs is a card game built around the rich world of wild animals that offers a variety of ways to play. It develops problem solving skills in a way that is accessible to preschoolers, enjoyable to kids, but is also challenging to parents.

On each card is an animal species and on each side of the square are that animal's: Classification, Diet, Conservation Status (from the IUCN) and World Region. These will be used to match cards that are played in the game. Depending on the game style chosen, a player's cards may be face-down or held. Depending on the number of cards in the final version, it could range from at most 5 to 8 players.

The challenge of each game style is to make connections. Only cards that have a link (a correct match) can be played off of another. When the game area begins to get larger it, playing cards may require more than one side to match. Every side of the card must match. In some games there are rewards for playing cards with 2, 3, or 4 connections (a double, triple or quadruple link).

The goal of each game style is to play all of your cards first.
174008.name: Zoo Webs

174009.name: The Excellent Travelling Volume (Issue 1 - Dec 2014)
174009.description:
The Excellent Travelling Volume
Issue #1
December 2014

Cover art by Jason Sholtis.

174010.name: The Escape
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 56 - Dialect, The DIg RPG, Threadbare RPG
174010.description:
User Summary:

A two page prison escape scenario for Dungeon World, full of undead. Also, the Chupacabra Pup!

174011.name: Go Bananas!
174011.description:
A print and play variant of the classic game Pit! Designed to be used for 4 or 5 small groups as a warm up activity for an event promoting fair trade.

The game is played in four or five small teams of 3-5 members.
Jigsaw-style pieces of bananas with pictures of banana producers around the world plus letters spelling out the word FairTrade are shuffled and distributed evenly. Teams then have to swap pieces with other teams (always one for one, two for two etc) to collect all the pieces with the same picture. However, trading is done by shouting the number of pieces you want to swap. You only know how many pieces you are getting, not what picture is on them. Teams then have to assemble the pieces into a complete banana. Whichever team does this first wins.

174012.name: The Clockwork Defector
174012.description:
From publisher blurb:

A brilliant but disgruntled German scientist has slipped his minders and is en route to Constantinople. Can your team of British operatives keep the defector safe against German agents, mad scientists, and more?

The Clockwork Defector is a "Penny Dreadful" adventure for Brass & Steel: A Game of Steampunk Adventure. The Penny Dreadful format provides an adventure outline with short scene descriptions and a cast of characters but leaves the last stage of development up to the imagination and tastes of the Gamemaster. It can be played as a stand-alone scenario with pre-generated characters or integrated into an ongoing campaign. The scenario is appropriate for characters of all experience levels.

174013.description:
Well, the crazies finally got one right. The end is nigh, and they called it. A two-mile wide asteroid will strike Earth at midnight, wiping out humanity… just like they predicted. You were one of the lucky ones to secure your spot in a bunker, ensuring your own survival. Some late-comers aren’t so lucky, though. You need to determine who stays and who goes.

There are rumors of cult members infiltrating and sabotaging bunkers to fulfill their doomsday prophecy. Choose wisely!

In The End Is Nigh, players have twelve turns to weed out the cultists among the on-trial refugees. On your turn, you must question a refugee to learn more about them, inform your associates of your findings, and then cast your vote for exile. Beware though! Some of the refugees have effects that can interfere with your investigation, and after being questioned, refugees will remain “exhausted” for a turn, preventing the next player from questioning them.

When the clock strikes 6, the refugee with the most exile markers is turned away from the bunker. Questioning then continues until 12, when the second refugee is cast out. If even one cultist manages to makes it inside, humanity is doomed. Who will you vote for?
174013.name: The End is Nigh
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 029 – Why Jam Improves Your Game

rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (2nd Edition)
174014.name: Magna Veritas - Bittersuss & Rabenschwarz
174014.description:
From the back of the book:
Magna Veritas und sein Gegenpart In Nomine Satanis sind Dark Fantasy Rollenspiele voll schwarzen Humors, der tiefer schneidet, als eine Waffe es je vermag.

English translation:
Magna Veritas and his counterpart In Nomine Satanis are dark fantasy role playing games full of black humor that cuts deeper than a weapon ever can.

174015.name: Mythic Clothing
174015.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Clothing is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to mythic magic items that create unique mythic effects. Some can be used only by mythic wearers, while others are useful for all characters but have effects enhanced or new abilities unlocked in the hands of mythic wielders. Mythic Clothing brings you 4 brand-new items: the foamfollower's jack, robe of tongues and teeth, scorpion cloak, and slippers of star-striding!

174016.name: Warlock: Patron of Smokeless Fire
174016.description:
From publisher blurb:

YOU are the master!

You are no sniveling witch to beg for scraps of magic from so-called "otherworldly patrons." No! You hunt down ghosts, spirits, &, yes, even gods & bind them to your will. Why enthrall yourself to some imaginary being? Unleash the powers of hell as you see fit!

The Smokeless Fire is a new otherworldly patron for your fifth edition warlock, including:

An entirely new specialty for your warlock to pursue
A new Smokeless Fire expanded spell list or a choice of 3 new gods
the Efreeti of the Lamp
the Hungering Dark
or Ol'Granny Death

A new pact boon enabling your otherworldly patron to lay waste to your enemies
15 new eldritch invocations!

174017.description:
Pets are awesome companions that join you on your quest for Pixel Glory! Pets stay by your side every turn to help you slay monsters in the dungeon. You acquire a pet in the town/drafting phase by choosing to draft one instead of a spell. Before the town/drafting phase, one pet for each player is shuffled into the spell deck - players may only use one pet.

This expansion is exclusive to Kickstarter and conventions.

Base-game reminder:
Pixel Glory is a fast-paced dungeon crawling card game for two to four players that plays in 20 minutes and takes five minutes to learn. Team up with fellow wizards to vanquish the sinister monsters that lurk in the dungeon, and save the nearby village. This is a noble and honourable quest, and... oh, who are we kidding? In reality, you're a greedy wizard who is all about fame and personal gain, and your fellow wizards are cut from the same cloth! Prevail over your opponents by learning the best spells and using that knowledge to out-manoeuvre and kill-steal in the dungeon, so you can gain admiration of the townsfolk, fame across the realm, and achieve Pixel Glory.
174017.name: Pixel Glory: Pets Expansion

174019.name: Adventures in the Terran Star Empire
174019.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pocket-Sized Adventures in a vast and decaying inter-stellar empire

The Terran Star Empire is a vast and decaying interstellar empire based on the classic science fiction space operas of the 1950s and 60s.
Adventures in the Terran Star Empire is the second in a series of Pocket Sized Adventures, a set of paperback sized, quick to learn and easy to play role-playing games. They are designed to be picked up and played with minimal preparation, effort or fuss

174020.name: Dwarf
174020.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

This class is available in Labyrinth Lord. It has been modified to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

174021.name: Gnome & Halfling
174021.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character classes for use with Labyrinth Lord.

These classes are available in Labyrinth Lord and Labyrinth Lord: Advanced Edition Companion. They have been modified to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

174022.name: Magic-User
174022.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

This class is available in Labyrinth Lord and the spells in Labyrinth Lord: Advanced Edition Companion. It has been combined and modified to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

174023.name: Warband
174023.description:
Warband provides all the rules you need to bring great battles between fantasy armies to your tabletop.

Using miniature figures and terrain, you can fight battles from the glorious sword and sorcery epics you've read about.
Miniatures are based on 10x5cm bases, allowing you to create miniature vignettes or dioramas for each unit.

Warband is designed to be simple to learn and difficult to master, and so it uses a single consistent task resolution method throughout the rules. Whether you’re trying to get a unit of warriors to move, seeing how effective it’s shooting or fighting is, or how well it has defended itself, you’ll be using the same dice pool mechanism. You determine the number of dice to roll and each result of 4+ is a success. The more successes you roll, the better your units will do, and the more likely you are to win. Simple!

Of course fighting a good tactical battle, getting your units into advantageous situations, and making effective command decisions will mean you’ll be far more likely to win. Coming up with effective tactics for your chosen army to defeat your opponents is what will take you time to master.

So with Warband’s intuitive rules you’ll be fighting the battle not the rulebook, and hopefully having a lot of fun into the bargain!

You'll be able to decide which of the fantastic races you'd like to command and then construct your force from the lists provided.
Warband includes complete army lists for twelve armies, with abilities, options, spell lists, and descriptions including;
Barbarian men, Dark elves, Dragon men, Eldritch vampires, Goblins, High elves, Hill dwarves, Lizardmen, Samurai apes, Taurians, Undead, and Wood elves. Each army is balanced by being constructed from a fixed 500 point cost. Powerful units cost more so are rarer. A typical warband will have 10-12 units, representing an army of maybe 3000 warriors.

Army composition and optional upgrades are highly flexible, allowing you to build the force that best fits your style of play. If you'd like to command a horde of bison riding barbarians, rampaging minotaurs, skirmishing ghouls, or serried ranks of deadly elven archers then you'll find something to suit you in the Warband rules. This flexibility means that you should be able to play with your favourite fantasy race in a way that suits your personal style and preferences, while your force still retains a unique and interesting character.

174024.name: Elemental Dice
174024.description:
Elemental dice is inspired by the classical elements of Earth,Water,Fire and Air. This five dice game comes with rules for 2 different games; Elemental Battle (played with 2 dice) and Elemental Bind*.
---
Elemental Battle: Each player Taket 2 dice. One spare dice is left aside. Each player throws one dice in turn. the strongest element thrown wins and the winning player retains both dice.
Players continue to throw until one player is out of dice and must pick up the spare. The winner is the player who takes all of the dice.If at any stage players get the same result the dice must be rolled again.
---
Elemental Bind*:
The first player throws all the dice, trying to get the best result according to the chart or they may pick only 2 or 3 dice and throw the again to increase the score. Extra scoring rules are adding different ways to gain points giving to Elemental Dice a touch of strategy.
Both games are using the Elements value chart provided: 1)Creation(strongest) - 2)Earth - 3)Water - 4)Fire - 5)Air - 6)Time(weakest)and rolling scoring chart: 5 x creation - 5 x Air - 5 x Water etc.
If there are only two players, the winner is the best out of three rounds.

174025.name: Soft Fixers
174025.description:
User summary:
Soft Fixers is a deck- building game that includes an identity-hiding mechanism. The game is quick and plays in around seven minutes.

Each player shall play one of the 6 Fixers, who dream of world domination. Players buy cards from the fixed supply of 6 cards, and try to either fulfill the victory condition or eject all the other players from the game. If your identity is revealed by an Attack, you are out of the game.

Publisher's summary:
正体隠匿システムを複合させた7分で完了するデッキ構築ゲーム。
プレイヤーは世界を自分の望むようにしたい6人のフィクサーの1人となり
6種のカードによる固定サプライを購入しつつ
自分の勝利条件を満たすか、他人を全員脱落させることを目指す。
ATTACKにより自分の正体が暴かれるとゲームから脱落させられてしまう。

174026.name: The Unofficial Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms Summary
174026.description:
From the back cover:
Included in the first Bandit Kingdoms reference document:

Timeline of major Bandit Kingdoms events (597 CY - 598 CY)
A list of memorable and representative quotes from the region's players
Indices of all Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms adventures by:

Year
Adventure Path
Location




Summaries of:

All Living Greyhawk adventures set in the Bandit Kingdoms
Bandit Kingdoms adventure paths

174029.description:
Backing Zong Shi will allow you to acquire a number of exclusive game components that will only be available for this Kickstarter project. The first exclusive component is a representation of this project within the game, so you can help Zong Shi succeed both in real life and in the game! In addition to the project card you can also receive two additional Scrolls of Fortune not found in the game.

Both the project card and the Scroll of Fortune cards are exclusive to this Kickstarter Project and will never be reprinted again for any purpose.
174029.name: Zong Shi: Kickstarter exclusive cards

174030.name: RoboDrome
174030.description:
Welcome to the RoboDrome. Test your skills as you control your robot in the premier robot battle arena. Make use of all your tools and wits to out think and out maneuver your opponent. Two bots enter, one bot leaves.

RoboDrome is a microgame for two players that uses elements of programming, hand management, and strategic movement to maneuver around the board and damage their opponent with a variety of special weapons.

174031.name: Party Time: The Game That's as Fun as You Are
174031.description:
Description of Party Time:
Party Time is a drinking game that tests the creativity and courage of the players involved. Discs are distributed evenly among all players who then write a challenge on the dry-erase side. The unique, custom-made challenges are where the greatness of Party Time lies. Players should write something wacky, funny, weird, embarrassing, physically demanding or thought-provoking -- the more creative the challenges are, the more fun the game is. After all the discs have a challenge written on them, place them face down discs into cells of the box. Players then take turns bouncing the ping pong off the table and into the box. If you miss - you take a penalty drink, if you hit an empty cell - everybody drinks, but if you bounce the ball into a cell with a disc - that player pulls out the disc and must do whatever is written on the back of the disc. After you’ve completed your challenge, keep the disc and pass the ball to the next person. You get one bounce per turn, and the ball is passed clockwise around the table/group. Continue playing until all the discs have been drawn. The player with the most discs wins, but really, if there’s drinking and having fun with friends -- everybody wins.

Some examples of challenges are:


Truth or Dare
Kiss the person across from you
Take a mystery shot
Keep in physical contact with the person on your left for the rest of the game
Shotgun a beer with a friend
Exchange an article of clothing with the person on your right
Share your last five Google searches
Give out superlatives to all players

174032.name: Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius
174032.description:
As Captain Kayto Shields, embark on a galactic voyage of heroism and survival. With his home world destroyed and his nation conquered, the inexperienced Captain Shields, and his newly minted vessel, the Sunrider, are left as the only hope against a galactic evil intent on subjugating all sentient life.

Source: The Game Website.

174033.name: Munin
174033.description:
MUNIN the raven, faithful messenger to Odin, now stands stripped of wings and transformed by Loki into a mortal girl. Flightless and determined, she will stride the nine worlds of Yggdrasil to reclaim the lost feathers and return to Asgard.

MUNIN bolsters the traditional side-scrolling experience with the use of rotating environments to surpass obstacles and to solve puzzles. By twisting portions of the environment, players will create bridges from pillars, turn walls into floors or open new passages.

Further gameplay elements, like switches, moving environment or items influence by physics add even more depth to the puzzles: by rotating the game's world, boulders and debris will rumble, roll and fall. Liquids like water or lava will flow accordingly and Norse runes will show the way to the raven's lost feathers.

MUNIN features a total of 77 levels set in nine different worlds.

Source: The Game Website.

174034.name: Schlock Mercenary: Kickstarter promotional items pack
174034.description:
Includes:


Tagon Dice: 5 custom dice that includes Tagon's logo in place of the 6.
Extra Character Sheet + Token: Andy, our multi-limbed friend. He has a lot of actions. This is an advanced copy of the character that will be included in a future release, but you get to play with him early.
1 Tagon Patch
An additional promotional Large Floor Tile (6" x 6", double sided) that will be part of the 2013 Convention Give away promotions.
An additional Connecting Floor Tile (1.5" x 3.0") featuring a secret room onboard the ship where you can pick up extra Power Ups.
A Schlock Mercenary Die / Tile bag.
An Extra Scenario
A Second set of Extra Dice with Partnership Logo.
An Alternate Plasma Gun Flying Schlock Character Sheet
A Blank Character Sheet for Funsies
Dice Cup + Punchboard
Wooden discs for the characters in addition to the normal chipboard tokens
Additional chipboard tokens featuring a number of characters with their heads in the Nanny Jars. Sure to be a hit when push comes to shove comes to knife comes to pistol comes to plasma cannon comes to crippling injury with horrific pain.

174035.name: Time Flux: Origins of War
174035.description:
Time Flux is an EXPANDABLE CARD GAME (ECG) based on time travel that is designed for 2-4 players. Each player is represented by a "Time Traveler". Your Time Traveler is your character card that has special abilities and can travel through time by moving in and out of "Eras". Eras are several cards that make up a playing surface similar to a board game. Depending on which Time Traveler you choose, the playable Eras will change! The object of the game is to kill all other Time Travelers so you can control time and ultimately gain the ability to change the future how you see fit.

Game play lasts an average of 10-20 minutes for a 2 player game and winning a game feels phenomenal! Multi-player games are even more fun than playing 1 on 1 and require a different kind of strategy to win. Multi-player games last 40-75 minutes. Although Time Flux is simple to learn, defeating an experienced player or winning a multi-player game requires a skill set on par with Chess; easy to learn and play, but difficult to master!

174036.name: Conquest
174036.description:
Κατάκτηση (Conquest) is a wargame very much alike to Stratego.

The gameboard is a 3D battlefield. You have an army of men at your disposal and your mission is to win your opponent's army.

174037.description: Battle for Proteus Prime is an action-packed two player game set in the exciting Firestorm Planetfall Galaxy. Discovery of a hidden technology has turned the surface of the long-abandoned world of Proteus Prime into a deadly warzone as the Aquan Prime and Directorate battle for victory.
174037.name: Firestorm Planetfall: Battle for Proteus Prime
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 148 - Planetfall

174038.description:
This exhilarating Firestorm Armada Battle Box brings two stunningly detailed fleets to the gaming table: the fast and nimble Aquan Prime and the stealthy mega-corporation that is the Directorate.

Locked in a deadly conflict above the planet of Proteus Prime, the Commanders of these great fleets must not only do battle with each other, but face the unknown mystery of the giant Dimensional Gate in orbit above the planet and the strange probe ship that has emerged from it. An epic battle is taking place above the planet of Proteus Prime. So gather your forces, Commanders... it is time for war!

Firestorm Armada is a fast paced, exciting tabletop game of spaceship combat set in a deadly, distant future.
174038.name: Firestorm Armada: Stormzone – Return of the Overseers

174039.name: Against Time
174039.description:
Κόντρα στο χρόνο (Against Time) is a party game that requires a touch of knowledge but mainly quick thinking!

Every player in his turn rolls a dice and depending on where his pawn goes, he picks a card. For example he picks a card that requires him to note as many phytophagous animals starting from different letters as he can in 30 seconds. The next player has 60 seconds to write phytophagous animals, starting from different letters to the ones used by the first player.

Players get points going around the board and after a defined time the game is over and the player with the most points wins.

174040.name: Dystopian Legions: Codename Iron Scorpion
174040.description:
Codename Iron Scorpion is designed to be a self-contained game that packs a box full of fabulous models and tons of excitement. It is a perfect spring board for players wishing to immerse themselves in the Dystopian Legions Universe.

This boxed set is crammed with all you need to get to grips with the new Dystopian Legions 2.0 rules engine.

174041.name: Animalia Fighting PCG
174041.description:
Animalia Fighting PCG is a free print&play card game for 2 players.

In the game,you take the role of a leader of an animal society. You have to lead your animals to beat your opponent.

Try to let the opponent's foods more than six to win the game. But be careful! Food is resource. The more food the more powerful. Your opponent can use more food to call his animal fight back.

A series composed of seven packs.
The first pack in the series is basic Pack.The Basic pack includes 31 kinds of animals.Another six packs includes 14 kinds of animals.

Now,game has published the first series.

174043.name: Design & Pantomime
174043.description:
Σχέδιο & Παντομίμα (Design & Pantomime) is a party game that combines pictionary and pantomime!

Players are divided in two or more teams of at least two players each. Teams are tested in two tasks with time limits:
For the first one, a player is drawing in order to make his teammates find what he is drawing. In the same manner for the second one a player is acting without making any sounds, so that his teammates find the right answer!

A lot of fun and competitiveness comes through playing.

174044.description:
In Sultan's Library, you play as an Envoy sent out by the Sultan, exploring the world looking for Knowledge in the form of Books. Once you have found a Book, you need to make your way back to the Sultan’s Library and Deposit it. At the end of the game, the player who has the acquired the most Knowledge wins!

Each turn consists of 3 phases: Draw, Explore and Score.

1. Draw: In the Draw phase you draw two cards from the Action Deck. Action cards will let you do things like Travel somewhere without paying, making other players lose Actions etc. The Action Deck also has Journey cards in it, which allows you to pay for the various things you will be doing in the game.

2. Explore: In the Explore phase, you will pay Explore points to look around the area you are in for Books. If there are no Books near you, you will automatically move on to the next Location. You have 2 Actions per turn. You can do things like Explore the Area, Play Action Cards, Pick-up and Deposit Books etc.

3. Score: In the Score phase, you place all the Books you Deposited this turn under your Character card. You have Scored as much Knowledge as is indicated on all your Deposited Books. Once someone Deposits 3 Books, the players finish out the round and whoever scored the most Knowledge wins!
174044.name: Sultan's Library

boardgameintegration: Dystopian Wars: Battle for Iceland 2 Player Box Set
Dystopian Wars: Battle for Iceland 2 Player Box Set
174045.description:
Set in the waters around South America, Operation Shadow Hunter pits two bitter enemies against each other: the Empire of the Blazing Sun and the Federated States of America.

In territory that once belonged to the Republic of Argentina, the forces of the Empire of the Blazing Sun are once again on the move. Their plan is complex, their overall objective still a secret, but the dice have already been rolled and the battle lines drawn. The eastern forces have a new and deadly ally. The infamous Wani have returned from exile, contributing never-before-seen technology to seal their new pact of service with the Empire.

To the north, the Federated States of America has responded with speed to the loss of its own vessels, both military and civilian. In a bid to counter the mysterious 'Ghost Ship' the chief scientists of this great nation have accelerated development of their own secret weapon - the Boston Class Submersible - and the American Admirals are eager to prove it in battle. Designed to engage and destroy even the most formidable enemy ships, the Boston Class comes armed with the latest advanced weaponry and a complement of Assault Subs.

The scene is set for lethal conflict as two of the deadliest naval forces on the planet clash in the once calm waters off the coast of Brazil.

Dare you take command in Operation Shadow Hunter?
174045.name: Dystopian Wars: Operation Shadow Hunter

174046.name: Dropzone Commander 2 Player Starter Set
174046.description:
Hawk Wargames is pleased to announce the brand new Dropzone Commander 2 Player Starter Set! It is designed to be one of the most complete wargaming starter sets ever released. Containing two sizable starter forces, the full sized 1.1 DZC Core Rulebook, plenty of accessories as well as a starter battlefield with a set of card scenery, the only other things a new player will need are glue and paints! This boxed set makes a fantastic entry point into the Dropzone Commander universe as well as a great way for existing players to add to the core of their forces.

All the 10mm scale miniatures in this box set are injection moulded in plastic. These crisply moulded models feature extremely fine detail, matching our resin kits in quality. Be sure to check out the photo gallery (by clicking on the product image) for a visual tour of this amazing box set!

174047.name: Lexomachies
174047.description:
The game contains 300 cards - crosswords. It' s something between battleship and crossword puzzle, where you guess letters and words of your opponent to solve the crossword.
Highly competitive game which combines knowledge with brightness!

174048.name: Hordes: Two-player battle box
174048.description:
In a fantasy world ravaged by warfare, warring factions clash in a primal struggle for domination. Huge warbeasts stride into battle, tearing enemies apart with tooth and claw, while epic warlocks smite their enemies with ancient spells - in this bitter age of fighting, who will emerge victorious?
The Legion of Everblight inhabit the harsh frozen northern wastes, and have descended upon Immoren - tainting the lands with corruption. The Druids of the Circle Orboros clash with the forces of Everblight in an attempt to halt their spread.
The seemingly unstoppable Kaya the Wildborne leads the Orboros attack, accompanied by her loyal pack of warbeasts - while Lylyth, the Herald of Everblight has called upon her savage Dragonspawn to help her repel this dark foe.

174049.description:
Grab your buckets and spades and build the best sandcastles on the beach.

In this light and simple but strategic game, you can add to sandcastles with bucket, crab and seagull cards. You can steal sandcastle parts from other players. And when your sandcastle is complete, you can earn bonus points as well as the points for the sandcastle you have built — but be warned that others will be aiming to grab bits of your sandcastle and trying to steal your bonuses.

Sandcastles plays 3-7 players as well as having a two-player variant and a solo game.

Sandcastles is another of YAY Games '2 Turns to Learn' games.

In April 2016 'Sandcastles' won the prestigious Griffie Award for Best Card Game 2016. This award is voted on by attendees at Scotland's longest running fantasy and gaming convention. Last year YAY Games won Best Board Game for 'Frankenstein's Bodies'.
174049.name: Sandcastles

174050.name: Game Master's Guide to Friends
174050.description:
From publisher blurb:

Snatches of conversation, laughter, and the thud of mugs rumbled around the smoky room. Durnick leaned back in his chair and waited for the waitress to finish placing their mugs on the table and heading off to the next customer before leaning forward and continuing the conversation.

“You heard about Oliver?”

“No,” Kor said as he picked up a mug.

“He headed off into the Diremirk. Heard he got himself lost, or killed.”

Halflings, cyborgs, telepathic felines, and alien bartenders, friends for characters come in all shapes and sizes and can play many roles in the campaign, from informant and supporter to captive or comrade. Friends can supply the characters with a needed piece of equipment, a hideout or the objective of an adventure when they become captured or trapped in a dangerous area. Player character friends can become a vital part of a campaign. And that is what the Game Master’s Guide to Friends is all about.

The Game Master’s Guide to Friends is the first in a new series of role playing game supplements. Suitable for any role playing game, the Game Master’s Guide to Friends provides the GM with advice, ideas and examples for including friends for the player characters in a campaign. The Game Master’s Guide includes sections on meeting potential friends, encountering friends during the campaign, the roles friends play, the lives of friends and examples for each section. Friends connect a character to the setting and events in a very important way, making hooks, encounters and adventures much more personal for the character. Whatever rpg you play, the Game Master’s Guide to Friends is sure to provide you with some useful ideas and examples.

174051.name: Tara: Marauder of the Spacelanes
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
174051.description:
From publisher blurb:

OUTLAWS OF OUTER SPACE!

Falsely accused of piracy and murder, Robin, Malo, and their leader Tara fight injustice everywhere they find it throughout the solar system while staying one step ahead of corrupt officials of oppressive governments.

Tara: Marauder of the Spacelanes, created by Gene Fawcette, is retro sci-fi comics at their finest, augmented by roleplaying game material for the OGL d20, OpenD6, and the ROLF! game systems. The collection also features a fiction vignette detailing the never-before-revealed circumstances under which Tara and her crew became outlaws.

174052.name: Hollow Thune
174052.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,

The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. Some worlds teeter on the verge of apocalypse – and others are well past it.

Hollow Thune has suffered more than its share of calamities – a genocidal global war, the fall of a decadent military empire, and the hollowing-out of most of the world by the all-consuming maw of Shadow. In these dark days, voracious Erebi bore through the planet like worms through a rotten apple, subterranean morlocks scrape for survival in ancient underground ruins, and defunct tyrants clutch desperately at the last drops of power. And so, reeling from the atrocities of war, trapped inside the crumbling shell of a dead world, hopelessly besieged by a merciless horde of reality-nullifying alien horrors, somehow... impossibly... life goes on.

174053.name: Dimensional Wayfarer Hybrid Class
174053.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travel the planes and master the fantastic hazards of the multiverse!

Featuring the Dimensional Wayfarer Base Class:

A cleric-sorcerer hybrid class, specializing in walking the planes of the multiverse, and safeguarding its secrets. Using specialized dimensional knowledge and the power of the planes themselves, these wardens protect the very fabric of reality from those terrors that would rend it apart.
Almost two dozen new spells tailored to the Dimensional Wayfarer.
New options for oracles and summoners.




And much more!

174054.name: Famous Missions
174054.description:
Famous Missions is a party game where players put together their best team of famous (and sometimes infamous) personalities to handle the mission at hand.

You need to dismantle a bomb, QUICKLY! You look around and see George Lucas, Donald Trump, Oprah, Gene Simmons, Danny DeVito, Joan of Arc and Shaquille O'Neal. Who will you choose?

Choose 3 and defend your choice. You'll need to argue for them later.

174055.name: Go Bong!
174055.description:
Like its predecessor Last Mouse Lost, the playing area of Go Bong! consists of a rubber grid with raised "bumps" that can be pushed down with your fingers. Once all of the bumps have been pressed, you can flip the board over and play again on the other side.

To play, two players alternate turns pressing down one or more bumps in the grid, with these bumps needing to be in the same horizontal, vertical or diagonal row. Whoever pushes down the final bump loses.

Go Bong! includes solitaire challenges.

174057.description:
Kajko i Kokosz: Przygody Wojów is a third game in the series of Kajko and Kokosz adventures. In this game players try to collect as many treasures as they can and avoid fighting with brigands and other ruffians.

At the beginning of the game there are formed 10 stacks (differed by color and number) of cards (with treasures and brigands) in the middle of the table. Each player receives 2 or 3 characters.

On every player's turn the player has to choose one of the two following actions:
1. She can take one card from one of the stacks and place it face up in front of her.
2. She can send all previously gathered cards to the castle using one of her characters.

Players try to gather as many cards as they can, but the more they have the more they fear to lose it all. What's more action 2 can be performed only 2 or 3 times per game (each character can be sent once). The players also try to remember in which stack the bad cards were taken, because every stack contains the same set of cards.

The game ends when all of the players have sent all their characters or when nobody has anything more to send and there are no cards to draw. The treasures has different values, which players count. The players who scored the most is the winner.

There is also an advanced variant, which present the 10 bonus point card, which is given at the end of the game to the player who gathered most coins amongst his treasures. There is also a rule that when a player draws coin in the hand, she has to give it to another player and steal all coins from the chosen player.
174057.name: Kajko i Kokosz: Przygody Wojów

174059.name: Colonist Entrepreneur
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
174059.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. New and experienced players alike will appreciate these handy reference cards, and GMs will love being able to keep the action moving. You'll have the text of your talents at your fingertips, leaving you free to focus on the challenges at hand, while art for each talent immerses you even further into the Star Wars universe. First introduced in the Far Horizons sourcebook, the Entrepreneur specialization is for characters who know the power of wealth and can handle any situation with a sharp mind, a fist full of credits, and the cards from the Entrepreneur Specialization Deck. For Entrepreneurs, wealth is never a problem, just a solution. These are not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook is required to play.

174060.name: Colonist Marshal
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
174060.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. New and experienced players alike will appreciate these handy reference cards, and GMs will love being able to keep the action moving. You'll have the text of your talents at your fingertips, leaving you free to focus on the challenges at hand, while art for each talent immerses you even further into the Star Wars universe. First introduced in the Far Horizons sourcebook, Marshals keep the peace in Outer Rim towns. A Marshal is often the only thing standing between law and chaos, but you can always count upon the cards from the Marshal Specialization Deck to help you dispense justice with a steady hand and steely demeanor. These are not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook is required to play.

174061.name: Colonist Performer
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
174061.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. New and experienced players alike will appreciate these handy reference cards, and GMs will love being able to keep the action moving. You'll have the text of your talents at your fingertips, leaving you free to focus on the challenges at hand, while art for each talent immerses you even further into the Star Wars universe. First introduced in the Far Horizons sourcebook, the Performer is always the center of attention. Whether you're a musician, actor, comedian, or other entertainer, keep the spotlight on your performances, and use the attention to your advantage with the cards from the Performer Specialization Deck. These are not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook is required to play.

174062.name: Colonist Signature Abilities
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
174062.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. New and experienced players alike will appreciate these handy reference cards, and GMs will love being able to keep the action moving. You'll have the text of your talents at your fingertips, leaving you free to focus on the challenges at hand, while art for each talent immerses you even further into the Star Wars universe. First introduced in the Far Horizons sourcebook, the Performer is always the center of attention. Whether you're a musician, actor, comedian, or other entertainer, keep the spotlight on your performances, and use the attention to your advantage with the cards from the Performer Specialization Deck. These are not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook is required to play.

174063.name: Between Sand & Sea: Mythic Africa
174063.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Everyone knows Egypt, but Egypt is just one corner of Africa. Between the sand of the Great Desert and the sea of the Mediterranean lie the great cities of Marrakesh and Fes, home to merchants, scholars, and thieves. The Atlas mountains and the plains of the Tell are home to Tuareg and Berber nomads and raiders, and the ruins of Rome and Carthage still await exploration. Not all of the inhabitants of this land are human: the Blemmyae have no heads, bearing their faces on their chests, while the Panotii have ears so large that they can fly, and the isle of monkeys tolerates nothing human on its shores. Trade caravans from all cultures cross the Great Desert, but none know what lies beyond, or where the slaves brought north come from. Beyond the Bounds of the Order, this book provides cultural and magical details for the lands of Mythic Africa west of, but not including, Egypt. From the jnun to the dark gods of old Carthage, from the bustling cities of the Tell to the wind-haunted mountains and deserts, this is a land that will take magi away from the familiar. Whether building a new covenant outside the Tribunals, or visiting in search of magical secrets, there is something for every maga between sand and sea.

174064.description:
Relive and refight the Battle of Waterloo by leading your troops on as either Emperor Napoleon or the Duke of Wellington. Will you succeed in punching through Wellington’s lines before the arrival of the Prussians or will you, as Napoleon did, "Meet your Waterloo"?

Stratego Waterloo is a highly flexible tactical board game specially designed to commemorate the bicentenary of the Battle of Waterloo. Thanks to the basic, standard and expert game rules it will provide both casual and expert gamers an hour to an hour and a half of battlefield excitement.

Play as either Napoleon or Wellington and lead your infantry and cavalry into the fray, set up your artillery to wreak havoc on your opponents position! Relive and refight this epic but bloody battle: storm or bombard the farm of Hougemont, let your heavy cavalry charge down in a wild frenzy or let your brave marshal lead your excited troops into that gap in order to sever the enemy's lines of communications.

As Wellington, will you stand your ground and wait for the arrival of the Prussian reinforcements or will you take the inititiative and make the most of every mistake the French make? As Napoleon, will you start the battle early but with less troops or will you use your entire force to knock those British, Germans and Dutch from that ridge? YOU decide the destiny of Europe.

Although great care has been taken to offer the players a good ‘feel’ of the historical battle, the movable terrain tiles invite you to create and play any fictional battle. No time to play an entire battle and only a half an hour to spare? Then treat yourselves to a simple skirmish by using just half of the available pieces!

AWARDS & HONORS:

Nominated as 'most valued boardgame of 2015' Netherlands
http://www.speelgoedmagazine.nl/speelgoedmagazine-nl-awards/

Nominated for 'Toy of the year 2015' Netherlands
http://www.speelgoedvanhetjaar.nl/nominaties/categorie/12-pl...

Nominated for 'Boardgame of the year 2015' Belgium
http://www.hetspeelgoedvanhetjaar.be/2015/nl/participants-06...
174064.name: Stratego Waterloo

174065.description:
Pan tu nie stał! Demoludy is a reimplementation of a Reiner Knizia game Gem Dealer. This game is also a sequel to the game Pan tu nie stał! (which is a Polish version of Great Wall of China).

The mechanics were wrapped into a theme of 70's and 80's in communist countries of eastern Europe. In this game players take a trip from Poland, travelling by popular in that time cars and try to collect a set of items bought in four (out of five) different countries. The countries presented in the game are: GDR (German Democratic Republic), Czechoslovakia, HPR (Hungarian People's Republic), Turkey and USSR (Union of Soviet Socialist Republics).

Every round is an auction. The starting player takes one tile of a chosen color (country) and place it in the middle of the table. She then make a starting bid which has to contain at least one card of a matching color. The next player may present a higher bid or pass. After every bid or pass a player draws one new card from the deck and adds it to her hand. The player who already passed is omitted. The auction continues untill all but one player pass. The winner takes the tile, puts it in his car and starts a new round.

The first player to collect a set of four tile in different colors is the winner.

The game also features advanced rules. In this variant in order to win the players have to collect the four color set of tile with a value of at least 10. There are also action cards which can help to it's owner or mess up with other players' cards.

Demoludy vs Gem Dealer - differences
- In Gem Dealer starting player receives one card less than the others. Every player gets 5 cards at the beginning of Demoludy.
- In Gem Dealer there is a rule that if you lose a bidding contest while using wild card 10, you lose one of your previously gathered gem. There is no such rule in Demoludy.
- There is an advanced variant in Gem Dealer in which you have to gather 5 different gems, while in advanced variant of Demoludy you need 4 different items with a total value of 10 or more.
- There are no action cards in Gem Dealer which are in Demoludy.
- Demoludy also contains the expansion for Pan tu nie stał! (Great Wall of China): Bazar Różyckiego (which would be translated to: Różycki's Bazaar)
174065.name: Pan tu nie stał! Demoludy

174066.name: Pyramidion
174066.description:
You are a dwarf, and tasked with building track for a mine cart that has already left its starting point and is rushing fast to its destination.

Your team of fellow dwarves will attempt to assist you in this endeavor, however the task is not proving as easy as you'd hoped...

In Mine Cart, players will cooperatively lay down cards as track for a runaway mine cart. Cards can path off in any direction, limited only by your table space, but must match connecting symbols. These symbols also grant one time special actions, some good, some bad. No matter what one action you choose on your turn (draw, place, take track from back on line) the mine cart always moves one space further. The color of the space it lands on also causes 'something' to happen, so careful as you lay your track, giving lots of choices...

Players cooperatively lay track until the last track (last card on bottom of deck) is placed, however the dwarf with the most vp left in his hand of track is declared the master track builder and receives the promotion from his boss.

This game is an entry for the geekway to the west design contest. And while it won't win, i'm just blessed to be in a cool contest with such an amazing and awesome community that supports each other and is growing every day. Saint louis!!!

174067.name: FlipFight: Battle of Gettysburg
174067.description:
FlipFight is a series of strategic manual dexterity micro-games. Battle of Gettysburg is the first game in the FlipFight series. The game pits Union and Confederate forces against each other in the pivotal Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.
